author: {'steamid': '76561198047202639', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1550811703}
review:
Guns of Icarus Alliance is an incredibly immersive and exhilarating multiplayer experience that expertly combines teamwork, strategy, and fast-paced action. Players take on the role of a crew member aboard a steampunk airship, working together to navigate treacherous skies and engage in intense battles against enemy airships.

One of the standout features of Guns of Icarus Alliance is the emphasis on teamwork. Communication is key as players must effectively coordinate their actions to pilot the airship, man the guns, and repair damage during combat. The sense of camaraderie and cooperation that develops between players is truly rewarding and adds a layer of depth to the gameplay that sets it apart from other multiplayer games.

The graphics in Guns of Icarus Alliance are stunning, with beautifully rendered airships and environments that really bring the steampunk world to life. The battles are intense and adrenaline-fueled, with each victory feeling hard-earned and satisfying.

Overall, Guns of Icarus Alliance is a must-play for fans of multiplayer shooters and cooperative gameplay. Its unique concept, engaging gameplay, and strong emphasis on teamwork make it a standout title in the genre. I highly recommend giving it a try and experiencing the thrill of aerial combat in this immersive and engaging world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019964046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1705442496}
review:
The game itself is excellent fun at its core. There are definitely things that could be improved, but the core is great, and you can have plenty of fun with it.

But, the playerbase is far too small. PvP is often not even really an option due to the low player count, and a few PvE modes do require at least 2 players due to requiring multiple ships. You can still have some fun solo on a the other PvE modes, but admittedly, that's not where the game shines and is really best with multiple people (if only so you aren't forced to always be the pilot). But if you've got a few friends, it's very fun in PvE.

As for why the playerbase ended up so small, perhaps part of it is just that the game didn't get quite well-known enough in the correct time window to be able to grow. Another potential problem is that there isn't exactly a huge amount of unlocks, be they gameplay or cosmetic, which may have lost those who "somewhat enjoyed" the base gameplay, but need a little more incentive to stick around, which admittedly is probably a lot of people.

I know the devs do fairly regularly host PvP events, though admittedly, I am more of a PvE player. I was a backer on the Alliance expansion/game/whatever you want to call it, and I don't really regret it all that much, because I do enjoy what PvE is there.

I don't know if the devs will read this, but if you guys do, I just wanna say that I do think you made a good game. It's a shame it never really took off like it could have, but I do hope you are able to one day revisit the idea.

If only because, man, I really really want more airship/crew games :V

review:
Игра ошиблась местом, на мейл ру ей самое место. Доната больше чем нужно, игра без русского, ну и геймплей соответствующий.

Рекомендовать эту игру... ну разве что вам нужны карточки, в остальном смысла не вижу. Пустая трата времени.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228175000', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1525, 'last_played': 1693719417}
review: Positively great experience. It's bit old but still as fun as ever. The devs still foster a community that gathers for PVP regularly. PVE is quite a distinct experience from PVP. Fundamentally, the gameplay remains the same: frantically airship crews thrown in a scramble for victory or survival. But, different equipment and tactics are available to players and the goals have shifted with new gamemodes. The AI in PVE is generally less threatening than an enemy player but boss ships can be quite deadly. PVP or PVE can be much more fun (and effective) with a group of friends. It's a level of integration that you can't quite reach unless you play frequently with a group. While playing solo is possible, the fun of this game easily scales with the number of players; All the more reason to shill it to your friends!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1667950836}
review:
About Guns of Icarus Alliance I can say with confidence that this game is an experience like no other. The game's unique steampunk-inspired design and cooperative gameplay make for an incredibly immersive and exciting gaming experience.

What I love most about this game is the emphasis on teamwork and strategy. As a member of a crew, you must work together to pilot your airship, fend off enemies, and complete objectives. Each member brings their own unique skills and abilities, making every match both challenging and rewarding.

The game's graphics and sound design are top-notch, which only adds to the already immersive world that Guns of Icarus Alliance has created.

The game's developers are also incredibly active in the community, constantly updating and adding new features to keep the game fresh and exciting.

Overall, Guns of Icarus Alliance is an amazing game that should be on every gamer's radar. It's a must-have for anyone who enjoys cooperative gameplay, stunning graphics, and exciting action.

review:
Do i recommend this? Absolutely. I've only played the co-op so far, but this is one of the best games of this type I've ever played. Despite the graphics being somewhat dated, its still an amazing game. The only thing holding it back from being truly amazing is the lack of players. If you're on the fence about buying this, just wait for a sale and pick it up then. You really cant go wrong for less than a dollar.

Oh, and if you like steampunk, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217689948', 'num_games_owned': 1077, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1677257503}
review:
[b]Guns of Icarus Alliance[/b] to gra z gatunku [i]"za rok zamkną serwery"[/i]. Niestety, bo wydaje się być bardzo dobrą produkcją.

Rozgrywka oparta jest na pojedynkach sterowców, którymi można dowolnie manewrować, naprawiać je i strzelać z działek, które są na nich umieszczone - nic rewolucyjnego na tyle, by można było spaść z krzesła. Trailery jednak były bardzo obiecujące i zapowiadały prostą grę do sieciowej kooperacji na kilka godzinek. Z nadzieją na chwilę zabawy gra trafiła u mnie na "kupkę wstydu" i czekała, aż sobie o niej przypomnę. No i sobie przypomniałem, ale gra niestety zdążyła w tym czasie umrzeć - według SteamCharts średnia z ostatnich 30 dni to 3,9 gracza. W praktyce oznacza to tyle, że nikt w nią nie gra, co ma decydujący wpływ na jej ocenę. Niby jest możliwość grania z botami, ale sztuczna inteligencja w tej grze jest strasznie prymitywna, więc "zabawa" samemu wygląda trochę jak mierzenie się z niewidomym kto zgadnie więcej kolorów na okładce kolorowanki - trzeba się postarać, by przegrać.

Dziwię się, że ta gra ma oceny bardzo pozytywne, gdy w tej formie przypomina niegrywalną, pustą w środku wydmuszkę, a nie pełnoprawny tytuł warty choćby kilku złotych. Jedyną nadzieją jest przekonanie kilku znajomych, by wejść razem do gry i spróbować się zmierzyć przeciwko sobie. Wtedy może jej zakup miałby sens. W każdym innym przypadku jest to bezcelowe.

Warto na koniec dodać, że chociaż gra jest dystrybuowana w oparciu o model b2p, to pełno w niej mikropłatności, które atakują gracza z każdej strony. Przypomina to gry usługi z chin albo jakieś mobilne potworki robione od szkicu w Unity. Szkoda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018142229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5846, 'last_played': 1690669956}
review:
This is a PVE review only!

The PVE part of this game is dead and broken.  2-3 years ago the seemingly only remaining Dev changed the rules to where it is no longer possible to go to war in PVE(Not possible to finish achievements).  The lowest difficulty setting(casual) is harder than the 2 above it(which scares away new players who don't know any better).  The Dev seems more interested in disparaging his player base than fixing the problems with his game.  One of the few remaining Mods states that he has messaged the Dev about fixing the broken elements of the game.  I have very little hope.

The game itself is very fun.  It has a ton of untapped potential.  There are a small amount of pleasant people who play on the weekend.

Unfortunately, the game is dead and broken.  And those in position to fix it, won't.

아트워크가 좋고 한때 열심히 해서 추억이 많이 깃든 게임. 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035467794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1698189186}
review:
This steampunk airship combat game is a sleeper hit and actually a very unique and fun game! It´s a pity I didn´t find out about it sooner. Even if I have started playing during the game´s 10th anniversary, the PvE community warfare is still going strong and it is now easier than ever to become a faction leader! Occasionally I can find also a PvP match, but I actually prefer co-op PvE in this game.
The basic gameplay loop revolves around 3 roles of airship crew: pilot, or captain, just stands behind the wheel and controls movement of the ship. The ships generally turn like a barn, so it is quite tactical and you need to predict the movement of the enemy ships. The engineer plays like a non-violent melee FPS or repair simulator: you just mash damaged components of ship with variety of tools. The strategy comes from using the right tool on the right component at the right time. The gunner is the least important, because engineers can also use guns mounted on ship, but gunners can improve the stats of the gun and can also change to different ammo types.
The graphics are still very solid, because they are a bit stylized and not trying to be super realistic. The smoke and fog effects are beautiful and the lighting changes the color palette of the whole scene. When your ship descends from a dark blue-ish gas cloud into a valley filled with last light of the sun just before the solar eclipse, the view is simply breathtaking!
Because the game is a multiplayer one, it all comes down to your ability to communicate (and to get along with) your crew. Some captains can be irritating with their demands, but they are just doing their job. As a new player, I have experienced only friendly behaviour from veterans, who also always offered me assistance. The community is small but very dedicated and new player friendly!

TL;DR: Don´t waste time like I did and go play this beautiful game right now! It is very worth to play even 10 years after release!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041129491', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14218, 'last_played': 1698445151}
review: This game is always tons of fun and deserves more recognition. Whether you're coming solo or as a group you will be welcomed and taught well by the small and loyal community the game holds. You should definitely not hesitate to join the skies of Icarus where you can innovate and create your own gameplay style in a satisfying and innovative manner, whether it be PVE or PVP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122337593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1697300358}
review:
Em Guns of Icarus, controlamos dirigíveis steampunk, como piloto, engenheiro ou atirador, e tem já uma longevidade impressionante de dez anos, para um jogo multijogador online.
 Os menus e a interface são dez anos depois, ainda superiores a alguns recentes. Tem variedade cosmética suficiente e os dirigíveis são bastante diferentes uns dos outros, alguns com uma boa manobrabilidade, outros velocidade, e todos com um excelente design. Quase tudo tem um bom design, sejam as personagens ou os cenários. A imersão presente aqui é rara em jogos online.
 O maior problema, para jogadores a solo como eu, são os modos para um jogador básicos. A Muse não adicionou a possibilidade de a i.a. assumir o controlo do piloto, e por isso o jogador só pode escolher essa opção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000119565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1632696316}
review: Amazing game, sea of thieves style ship co-op combat but it's airships and the combat happens in three dimensions. Has been suffering from a player drought lately, so hopefully this latest sale kicks things up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040450878', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1667706214}
review:
An uncommon theme (steampunk) with some good ideas, but a poor execution and several missteps along the way with regard to implementation, direction, balance, marketing, and monetization, prevented it from ever realizing its full potential.

As of this writing there are 3 players in-game, with a 24-hour peak of 41 players. The all-time peak was 2,142.

A 3rd party account and an internet connection are required to play. Guns of Icarus Alliance was released in 2017, but it's essentially the same as Guns of Icarus Online from 2012, it just has some additional co-op PvE stuff.

Unity engine build 5.5.4p3. I did not encounter any Linux-specific issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125060977', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1686863298}
review: I highly recommend this game even here still in November 2022. This game seems to have endless replayability and always has me on the edge of my seat thinking, "OMG! What needs repaired!?". I love having a 32 player match and 4 people on each air attack balloon because skill matters, as well as ammo type that's in the giant chain gun on your balloon if that's your weapon choice. The balloons are customizable and ship can be different. There is not to much depth with the loadouts and the way the balloons work as much as I'd like but overall, amazing game! P.S. I have turned off commenting to help foster a positive environment.

review: Для компании самое то, если вы без неё то к покупке не советую, хватит и 2 человек, ладно отвлёкся я. Игра просто класс, вы с друзьями орёте друг на друга, спорите кто что будет делать, чательно выбираете корабль, вместе прокачиваетесь, это незабываемые ощущения, К тому же что порадовало это то что можно себя на бота поменять, тебе надо отойти и опа, меняешь себя на бота, очень круто и полезно. Ну подведём итоги: орудий много, кораблей много, карты крутые, задания продуманные, за 100 рублей лучше игру такого геймплея не найти, ну если только sea of thieves, но она и дороже само собой. Единственное что не порадовало, это отсутствие английского языка, но там и так всё интуитивно понятно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090425974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1533179303}
review: The game was pretty dead when I played. Most of the players who play are experienced, leaving little room for new players to improve or learn. Solo play was nearly impossible, I prefer to be a captain, and occasionally heal a few items. you can juggle commands to the AI, but players ALWAYS want to shoot, and complain that "one specific gun" cant shoot the target THEY want to shoot. ignoring the pings that theres an enemy on the side where the close range gun is located, and the fact that half the ship isnt functional. being an engineer usually means fixing stuff all game unless you are on a long ranged ship. I like being an engineer, and a pilot. being a gunner is OK but i think its kinda boring, I think alot of players shoot the wrong parts of the ship with the wrong guns. some guns tear armor but get used on non armored parts, some guns destroy the balloon well but are being used against the guns/ armor. Community wasnt supportive, just critical and subjective. I payed for the game, but I wouldnt reccomend paying for the game when there is hardly any game to play. It is a really fun game though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1709748463}
review:
Guns of Icarus Alliance is a paid DLC pack for Guns of Icarus Online, which is a PvP only team based deathmatch game where you crew flying ships and shoot cannons at other players.  It was deceptively launched on Steam as a separate game, but does require ownership of Guns of Icarus Online for this to be played.

While the team based focus of the game was welcome, and inspired the game to have some "viral" success where most PvP only games don't, it was short lived success.  The focus of the game is pure PvP, there's no single player content.  Developers must learn that other players are not an acceptable substitute for adding content to a game.  Developers often opt for PvP-only as developing single player content is difficult and requires capable storytelling, writing, level design and a wide range of other game development skills and talent. The vast majority of PvP-only games fail because they don't go "viral", and without players, the game dies.  If there was a single player component, there would be a lasting substance to the game, however, in this case, while the game enjoyed a honeymoon with enough people to fill servers, that time is long over. 

SteamDB shows there's less than a handful of players at any time, and because the developers have misleadingly placed this on Steam as a separate game instead of as DLC where it belongs, and because there's no single player content, it's impossible to recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127197008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1640520039}
review:
I'll preface this buy saying, if it's on sale, buy it. You'll get more enjoyment out of this than anything else you'll buy for this price. Just do it. Now.

Guns of Icarus is a game about teamwork, fighting smart, setting up loadouts to suite your play style, hectic communication, and the grand satisfaction of a ship kill. Definitely a game best enjoyed with a crew of your friends in discord, but given the price, the hard part is having three friends.

Each crew member will need to fill a role, from pilot, gunner, and engineer. Pilot, well, pretty self explanatory. Best for that guy in your group who doesn't really like shooting games. pilot is actually super involved, and there's a big difference between a good pilot and a great one>

Gunner, pretty simple, man guns, shoot things. Figuring out which weapons with which ammo types is most effective in which circumstances is the name of the game here. Remember, you are aiming to do three things: Disable components, destroy armour, damage hull. Each weapon/ammo combo will be more or less effective at doing these three things. Also, don't slack on doing repairs! the engineer can't do everything.

Engineer, fix things, boost things, on occasion man the guns. ON OCCASION! Gunners will have ammo and weapons boosts, you do not. If you are blocking a gunner from doing his job, you're not doing yours. Doesn't seem as fun, but a good engineer can give massive boosts to the pilot and gunner, as well as keeping your ship in tip top shape.

The hardest part of course is getting these three roles to work well together.

Combine that with a decent amount of customisation, choosing between different ship types, and weapon loadouts, it makes for a lot of variety and freedom.

Overall, I recommend, although the servers are currently dead, you only really need a total of 16 players online to have a really good time, and hopefully this sale with help with numbers. I've personally bought 10 copies for friends today alone, so fingers crossed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966511621', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1640105895}
review:
Guns of Icarus Alliance is just Guns of Icarus Online with PVE and some other stuff added. Like GOI Online it is dead. And honestly, there's a reason for that. It just isn't very engaging.

You are stuck on a ship usually captained by someone else. You slowly glide around through areas with a lot of smoke. Sometimes you can shoot at the enemy, but the titular guns have a tiny cone of fire so most of the time you can't actually use them. At best you can fix some stuff, which isn't very engaging. And that's coming from someone who used to main Engineer in TF2 and Battlefield 3/4. You don't even have some sort of rifle you can fire or anything.

This game is so slow and boring i wouldn't recommend it if it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020298884', 'num_games_owned': 1108, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1667322612}
review:
In it's a-day, this game was some of the most fun I could have. People really felt the faction rivalries, and you'd always have a fun time, even if you were losing.

Now it's a little bit deader, tho you will still find matches.

So it really comes down to how much you love the art-style, and if airship combat is appealing. Cause the game is sound, you'll very rarely see a glitch or bug, and even rarer will it impact play. 
I love this game, and if it looks good, it's less then 5 dollars, give it a shot.

review:
Stay away from the community, but the game itself is fun with friends.

The ships are interesting to try, and the customization of guns allows you to really spice up your games to fit your playstyle. Without friends, though, the game is pretty boring, as the AI crew are only so good.

My crew and I have had a few run in with the community and it was pretty bad. The faction system is fun for the game, but anything beyond that should be avoided.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047488263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1638806910}
review:
If you like games like Sea of Thieves or Blackwake or other cooperative games where you and a few other people have to control a ship, then you will like this game.

The main objective is to take one of three roles on an airship (pilot, gunner, engineer) and try to survive while shooting at enemy ships or stationary targets (turrets, bastions, etc.). 

Unfortunately, the player base is pretty much dead and PvP is only possible if you play with enough friends or happen to be online at the same time as the other players. However, the PvE mode is challenging and a lot of fun with friends. Vacant positions on your ship are filled by AI characters who do an acceptable job. 

If you are aiming for a PvP experience, the game is not worth playing at the moment. However, if you enjoy PvE with a few friends, it's a great experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100760256', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1645082289}
review:
Guns of Icarus Online/Alliance: First Impression
Graphics: 7/10, Could be Better.
Gameplay: 7/10 Pretty fun and hectic, but has its flaws. Each Role has its ups and downs.
Playerbase: 3/10 The Games playerbase is pretty small, which is incredibly sad. 
-------------------------------- The Actual Review --------------------------------------------
    Lets start this off with a simple message: I do recommend this game. Its incredibly charming and incredibly fun.
Its unfortunate that the playerbase is pretty nonexistant. However this game despite that is still incredibly good. Hopefully the community some how gets revived. As for how the game handles:
The gameplay is quite simple in some aspects, You and 3 other players (Or AI) are tasked with managing an Air Ship with 3 Roles for 4 Slots: The Captain, the Gunner (You can also be a third engineer), and 2 Engineers. 
The Captain:
Your goal is to pilot the ship, and get you from Point A to Point B while coordinating the Crew. Its probably the hardest of the Roles to play and master.
The Gunner: The Gunner can use different Ammo Types in order to maximize your weapons effectiveness. This allows them to be a fairly important role, and the easiest to play.
The Engineer: The Engineer is essentially whats going to keep your ship alive. They are focused on repairing modules, buffing modules and turrets and general upkeep of the ship.
With this all being said, the game is incredibly fun. This is an old game but its worth picking up, especially for the price.
Final Verdict: Extremely good game, Price of $4.99 is fair, it has sales at times which drop the price as low as $0.49 making it an extremely cheap but worthy game. Glad I stumbled upon it

review: Wonderful game that deserves more recognition than it got. It is very unlikely that you will be able to play a VS. game due to the current lack of players, but the co-op that is available in alliances is still enjoyable to play by yourself or with a group of friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446388082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1638345345}
review:
Very enjoyable game to sit back and play when you have a lot of friends to play with. The combat is very fun, flying the ship is well implemented and fun, and the class abilities can be very fun to use. All in all I would recommend this game to anybody with a good group of friends to play it with.

The ship vs ship combat is very fun. With 3 classes to choose from, gunner, engineer, and pilot. Each class has role specific abilities and are generally pretty easy to pick up and fun to play. The different focuses of the different classes makes each one unique to play. 
While the gunner is trying to use special ammo to wipe enemy ships out of the sky before they wipe you, the engineers has to try and keep up with the ship damage, running around to repair damaged parts and buff them to keep ahead of problems. The pilot maneuvers the ship into optimal firing positions, helps direct overall what needs to be done. Things such as what to focus on repairing first, what ships to focus fire on, and where to move the ship. Combat is intense and fun for all classes and working together with your friends to keep your ship going and destroy the enemy is extremely enjoyable.

[b]HOWEVER[/b] if you do not have a group of friends to play this with, then I would absolutely not recommend buying this game. The online servers are very close to completely dead and getting a full lobby can sometimes be near impossible. There are AI's that will take the place of players on your ship to keep stuff running despite not having enough players and while they are pretty good the most fun part of the game is communicating with your ship and basking in the chaotic steampunk airship battling fun.

Overall I would definitely recommend this game if you and your friends want a fun and intense game to play together. This game is perfect for large groups as you can have up to 16 players in a lobby. For those that want to just buy the game for themselves, I would recommend against it. The playerbase is very small and while the AI isn't terrible, playing this game with a group of friends is where this game shines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022776795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1625938902}
review: This game is so much fun! Teaming up with friends on steam punk style airships doing coop PVE missions or PVP is just a thrill! One of my ships years ago became famous among players and everyone used to chant it's name! With no real consequences to losing, what really is there to lose? It's a great time and for a great price, and I love that there's actually some skill and strategy involved too! 10/10 recommend anyone to get this awesome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198287169618', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1625890836}
review:
Sky of Thieves.

Mano 1 Real no joguinho durante o Sale de verão da Steam, jogo bom pra k7 apelidei de Sky of Thieves. Você está em um dirigível que é bem semelhante a uma embarcação, nesse universo Steampunk podendo jogar modos PVP ou PVE. me senti jogando Sea of Thieves ou Blazing Sails nas alturas. tem diversas armas diferentes no dirigível, muito fogo pra apagar, e muita coisa pra concertar. Muito bom o game, recomendo. Vende as cartinhas ai e compra mano, 1 real tu leva o Aliance e o Online! única coisa ruim é que não tem tantos players assim no jogo, mas dá pra jogar com IA no time.
Certamente Sea of Thieves teve um pé de inspiração nesse game, já que é bem mais antigo.
Eu amo o gênero Steampunk, queria mais jogos que buscassem essa temática .

author: {'steamid': '76561198040005010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 491, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2026, 'last_played': 1622853241}
review:
Es hermoso este juegaso. Lastima que esta medio abandonado:
 +Todo el mundo debe cooperar para pilotar un barco volador, de alto poder militar. Estos barcos son gigantescos, variados y con mecanicas diferentes, para brindar experiencias mas alentadoras.
 + Buena cantidad de barcos, y accesorios para tu personaje.
 +Todos deben dividir sus papeles para ponerlo en marcha la nave:
  arreglarla cuando la dañen, manipular las armas, recargarlas o cambiarles la municion, Lubricarlas, actualizarlas o aplicar mantenimiento extra a los escudos, motores o el globo, De paso arreglarlos ante cualquier impacto, apagar los incendios, Inspeccionar con Binoculares en busca de enemigos o el objetivo, y por ultimo, tomar el timon y pilotar. Medio complejo todo, pero fundamenta bien, el cooperativo. 
 + La tematica Steampunk, con barcos voladores, aviones de guerra estilo WW1 y dinastias asiaticas, le sienta muy bien
 + La musica es epica y decente
 + Posee un modo adicional de conguista, en donde puedes invertir dinero (del juego base, nada de dlcs me refiero) en las provincias y expediciones, para dar paso a un evento mmo de escala mundial. Donde podras cooperar en esa guerra misma.
Pero aqui viene la contra:
 - Juego medio muerto. Pocos jugadores online y encima, este juego tiene extremada dependencia a ello. Carece de modo offline, o alguna campaña.
 - Abusivo excesivo de cosmeticos, tanto de pago de dinero real, como el de juego base, o algun regalo decente por jugarlo.

 8/10 - Joya infravalorada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401680097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1622824220}
review:
This used to be a great game but unfortunately the community, and worse, the developer behind it has turned to ♥♥♥♥.

Instead of doing anything about the abuse towards other players in this game, Muse Games' moderation staff actively enables their bully friends. This is not a rogue staff member - all of them up to Muse's lead Howard Tsao are fully aware but refuse to do anything.

To make matters worse, Muse Games is also actively disregarding European consumer protections by failing to provide all personal data they store, after multiple requests. These developers think they are above the law.

As it stands, I cannot recommend this game, or anything Muse makes to anyone.

Note: My play time is only low because I have been launching the game via https://store.steampowered.com/app/209080/Guns_of_Icarus_Online/ - pretty scummy of Muse to have two apps for the same game to split review scores.

----

Guns of Icarus players xedeon, HelFyre, FadedSilhoutte, Dementio, SlyCrossfox, Genesis and Kruegerz are bullies. The abuser Inkjet has not only been misusing the position as Muse community manager to protect those bullies but is actively helping them in attacking their victims. Muse Games head Howard Tsao is aware of this abuse going on but has chosen to silence me instead of rooting out the abusers and bullies in Muse and the community. Now it is up to you to speak up. Do you stand against bullying? Then step up and help stop this.

Bullies don't always realize the gravity of what they are doing. When you are however not only ignoring those that ask you to stop but take active steps to block them out there is no doubt that you are intentionally malicious. Stop this. Stop enabling bullies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074599747', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1626726624}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098534163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2849, 'last_played': 1620659782}
review:
The game is good gameplay wise, but it is suffering from lack of players. Around 10-20 players ingame and the numbers are shrinking every month. It is a shame. 

However the developers have caused it themselves. Why on earth does a game where you can barely a get a 2v2 lobby have moderators in most matches? Why do you need to need to be watched to make sure you behave correctly? Who judges what's right?

Why do I need to be silenced, just because Muse disagrees with me? Why do people need to be banned for naming their ships "offensively"?

I find it hilarious how Muse thinks there is anyone left playing this game to protect, whether its from "trolling" or "racism". Ironically Muse is the racist one here. Naming your ship "Black Lives Matter" is fine, "White Lives Matter" is not. So hey, if you wonder who does not like based on the color of the skin, now you know.

The game has very few players and yet apparently that's one too many.
Guns of Icarus has died because of this authoritarian dictatorship and silencing from Muse, It's sad.

review: One of the most original SteamPunk games ever. I mean, come on! Who hasn't dreamt of flying a ship in this sky as a little kid? On top of that, you're in war-like, post-apocalyptic world, divided by major factions... and you get to shoot stuff, repair ship or even be a captain! You have a vast selection of ships and equipment you can choose for various maps, enemies and gamestyles. In short, if you haven't played this game yet, it's like a missed dream you never knew you had :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198143922259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1660612543}
review: Dude. This game makes me sad. Me and my friends use to play this, and it was fun as fuck. Sadly, now-a-days there's so few people playing it, that you can't even play a full lobby match. I wish more people would play it. It's genuinely a fun game, and deserves a bigger playerbase. Please, let's bring this game back from the dead. I think the best way to do this though, is to just make it free-2-play, and find other ways to gain money from it. But as it stands right now, I can't recommend the game from just how little action you'll get anymore from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192872823', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1553809941}
review:
this game is amazing, the only down side is that no one plays it. the devs have spent a lot of time perfecting this game, and i feel that they have been under underappreciated, for whatever reason this game gets thrown in to the bottom of the list where games that have little to no reason to stay in business are still being played at the top. if anyone is debating weather they should get this game or not, i would suggest that you get the game BUT get the game with 5 other friends, that way you can form your own team to build up this game... otherwise you will just hate it. 

yes i got the game for free, but in my opinion if this game had a real player base, this game is easily a 25-40$ game (including the alliance part)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039967171', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1621129158}
review:
NEW EDIT:

After spending some more time in game. I feel I need to change this Review.

The game suffers from severe Elitism. They call it, "We're a Close Knit Community" But really means, "We've been here so long, it doesn't matter what other people think." They can be pretty condescending to some people, and expect you to know everything from the get go despite the tutorials being somewhat unapproachable.

It still suffers from a lack of player base. Big time. Barely 18 people on at any time. And no lobbies again unless some Mod, GM or Dev has placed it up for one of their weekly locked games. 

On top of that. If they believe it's in their best interests to pressure someone into doing something they want you to do, they will do so. All under the guise of, "It's for the fun of it."

Compromises in game are ignored or overlooked. In game concerns about not wanting to pursue certain roles are swept aside "For the Good of the rest" and not "For your own enjoyment".

Let's be honest here, we don't play games for other people enjoyment, but for our own. And when a bunch of elitist people try to force you to conform to their ideals it certainly doesn't promote personal enjoyment.

With a low playerbase, elitist players who look out more for their own enjoyment, and ignoring other peoples enjoyment and offers to compromise to try and reach that state. If I could rate this game well i'd be rating it fairly low.

I can't possibly give this game a positive review. The bad experiences while playing this game now greatly outweight the good. Immensely in fact.

Approach this game at your own risk. And be prepared for potential pressure to conform to other peoples wants, over your own. Be prepared for empty lobbies if it's not a lobby headed by this GM or that Dev.

If that's your cup of tea then good luck. But don't go into this thinking it's going to be easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047833037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3219, 'last_played': 1613552731}
review:
Was ich gut finde:
Super Teamspiel mit klaren Rollenverteilungen. Im MP- und Singleplayer-Modus nimmt man gleichermaßen an globalen Karten/ Fraktions-Zielen Teil. Der SP-Modus ist außerdem als Training ideal, jedoch nur als Captain möglich. Gute Rollen-Übersicht mit ausgewogenen Gewinnchancen auch für unerfahrene Spieler.
Individualisierung der Schiffs-Waffenbestückung ist ausgewogen, wie die Individualisierung der Spieler-Ausrüstung.


Was ich nicht so gut finde: 
Das Menü wirkt ein bisschen unübersichtlich aber mit etwas Zeit hat man den Dreh raus.
Das Spiel vermittelt im Intro und generell Atmosphärisch eine Rollenspiel- oder eine Fraktions-Orientierung.
Rollenspiel und Fraktionsspiel-Charakter existiert nur auf dem Schlachtfeld bzw. der Karte und ist sonst eher statisch. Die Maps hat man schnell alle gesehen.

Fazit: 
Ein spaßiger Zeitvertreib am besten Im Team mit Freunden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089245966', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7164, 'last_played': 1674547995}
review:
Highly underrated game.  Sure if you play it every single day, it gets a bit boring, but you'd have to do that for like weeks on end to stop enjoying this game.  This is a great "Friday Night" game with some friends.  It's really low key and doesn't take too long to learn and get good at it.  

And at the end of the day, the community is super positive so you don't have to worry about how well you're doing.  Everyone plays this game to just have fun, and honestly - that's pretty amazing these days.  So if you're sick of the CoD mindset, and want to play a strategic team-based game where you can be a mechanic, gunner, or PILOT while just enjoying the game for what it is - this is your game.

Also, this game was something like the 14th certified game on the MLG platform.  It should have been so much bigger than it was.  I am acquaintances with a couple of their development team, and they are just awesome people and are highly involved with the community.. even though there's only a couple hundred people playing at a time, they still care enough to set up events and make matches where they augment the rules for some truly silly game play (for instance, a match where there are virtually no resistance or breaks.. can we say bumper blimps?).

If you haven't played this, you need to.  It's not expensive, so buy it for you and three friends.  I guarantee a good time.

review:
This is a fantastic game. It has dynamic gameplay that is very engaging and deep. There's a bit of a learning curve but it's worth the trouble. There is a kind of satisfaction to it that can't be found in most other games.

The issue lies in the player base. There are very few people playing anymore which is a shame. However during sales and during weekends there are high times. Additionally because the sales are so good you can usually convince your friends (or enemies) to buy it during the sale and have a decently sized lobby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065791144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 57754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 221, 'playtime_at_review': 2344, 'last_played': 1712445255}
review:
If you already play Guns of Icarus or even if you don’t, Alliance is a hecka fun addition to GoI Online.  It adds some cool PvE mechanics and gives you goal to be striving for: world domination, of course.

The game mechanics can get a bit complex (as with GoI Onlne).  I've been around for a little while, and there are many things I don't understand yet.  My recommendation is to get a microphone and talk with the community in lobbies and during the matches.  The player base tends to be very welcoming and helpful.  We want new players to join and feel welcome, so we are more than happy to explain complex bits and support ya’ll where we can.

As a side note: For the full experience, you really wanna be on the official discord for the game and the discord for your faction (if they have one).  The lore and speculating on the game and world at large are part of the fun.  It also gives you a group to learn from and steal the knowledge off of.

The player base is a bit small (20-70 players online depending on the time), but those that play tend to be active in both matches and in the external discords.  A group also puts on regular events/ training classes that are designed to help new and existing players.  The Devs also are pretty active in events and matches, so don't let the low numbers discourage you.

Overall, this game is some good fun with some good people.  Give it a chance, we’d love to have you fly with us.

review:
Immer noch ein gutes Spiel das man am besten mit Freunden spielt.
Bis zu vier Leute können auf einem Schiff zusammen spielen mit bis zu 4 Schiffen pro Lobby (PvE).
Dann geht es darum die Mission zu schaffen und das Schiff dabei so gut es geht am Leben zu halten.

Es spielen nicht mehr so viele Leute wie früher, aber man findet eigentlich immer mindestens eine Lobby mit ein paar Spielern.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 875, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1527540087}
review:
[h1]PvE statt PvP [/h1]

[quote]Volle Kraft voraus! Äh, nein. Volle Kraft nach unten!
- Captain Drake, wenn er mal wieder voll den Durchblick hat[/quote]

Mit dem Kauf gibt es das Hauptspiel direkt mit dazu. Netter Zug von den Entwicklern!

[b]Gameplay[/b]
In “Guns of Icarus: Alliance” spielen wir jeweils als Crew von 4 Personen auf einem Luftschiff. Dabei spielt ein Spieler den Captain und Steuermann, während der Rest der Gruppe aus Schützen und Mechanikern besteht. Ziel ist es, die anderen Luftschiffe, ebenfalls mit 4 Mann Besatzung zu vernichten und sich gegebenenfalls mit Verbündeten zu koordinieren. Um nun einen Vogel vom Himmel holen zu können, muss der Pilot das Schiff so fliegen, dass die Schützen zunächst die Panzerung und dann den Rumpf des Zeppelings ins Visier nehmen können. Obendrein können auch verschiedene Mechaniken wie der Ballon, Waffen und Motoren angegriffen werden, was die feindliche Crew vielleicht in ihrer Beweglichkeit einschränkt. Der Mechaniker ist dafür natürlich ausgebildet, um Brände zu löschen und die Maschinen wieder flott zu machen. Aber das kann je nach Schwere der Beschädigungen schon mal ein wenig dauern. Grundsätzlich kann übrigens jeder Spieler auch jede Aufgabe an Bord übernehmen, jedoch gibt es spezifische Fähigkeiten und Ausrüstung für die jeweilige Klasse. So kann der Captain die Maschinen überlassen, der Mechaniker hat mehr Werkzeuge und der Schütze kann Spezialmunition einsetzen. Aber hey, wenn das Luftschiff eh gerade komplett abraucht und ich als Steuermann Nichts mehr machen kann, dann kann ich auch den Schraubschlüssel schwingen und den Motor hinter mir reparieren. Übrigens gibt es mehrere Luftschiffe, die man zudem verschieden ausrüsten kann. Spielübergreifend kann man sich noch einer Fraktion anschließen und durch Siege so Ressourcen gewinnen, aber das ist eher eine Nebensache. Im Gegensatz zum eigentlichen „Guns of Icarus“ ist „Alliance“ bewusst augerichtet, gegen computergesteuerte Feinde zu kämpfen. Zum Einen kann man das als Training ansehen, aber sich mit vier Schiffen und 16 Spielern gegen die fiesen NPCs zusammenzuschließen…Ja, das hat schon was.

[b]Story[/b]
In der Welt von “Guns of Icarus” gibt es mehrere Imperien, die miteinander im Krieg liegen. Besonders groß wird die Geschichte aber nicht vertieft, dafür erlebt man aber seine ganz eigenen Geschichten. So denke ich immer noch an so manche coolen Manöver meiner Crew auf meiner “Isabel”. Denn wenn man sein Schiff benennt, dann wirkt es doch schon viel intensiver, oder? So gelingen in Absprache mit anderen Captains schöne Angriffe und ich denke auch an die LAN-Partie zurück, wo wir mit 16 Leuten, also 4 Schiffen, gegeneinander und zusammen gekämpft haben. Wir waren alle Anfänger, alle haben durch den Raum gebrüllt und alle hatten riesigen Spaß. 

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Die Grafik könnte vielleicht etwas aktueller sein, jedoch ist das Spiel durchaus ansehnlich. Außerdem steckt ja auch ein eher kleines Team hinter dem Spiel. Übrigens kann man sich seine Spielfigur auch recht umfassend anpassen und auch neue Uniformen freischalten. Beim Fliegen erlebt man zudem ein schönes Freiheitsgefühl, was durch Windgeräusche auch verdeutlicht wird. Aber auch die Gefechte sind sehr knallig und gerade das Trefferfeedback fühlt sich richtig gut an.

[b]Fazit[/b]
„Guns of Icarus: Alliance“ setzt Kommunikation unbedingt voraus. Die Crew muss gut zusammenarbeiten und auch wenn man sich gut koordiniert, vielleicht kann es die andere Crew einfach besser. Am Besten findet man als 4-Mann Truppe zusammen und wagt sich gemeinsam an das Spiel heran. Das Tutorial ist dabei sowieso Pflicht. Wenn man aber den ersten Schritt getan hat, so wird „Guns of Icarus“ richtig spaßig und man teilt Siege und Niederlagen als Gruppe. Da das Spiel nicht mit knallharten Belohnungen kommt, ist die Community auch recht entspannt und es bleibt meist das Gefühl, gut gekämpft zu haben. Für mich war das Spiel auch einfach ein Höhepunkt auf der LAN-Party, den ich sicherlich nicht vergessen werde. Also, auf in die Lüfte mit euch!

Höhenangst? Dann bleib doch lieber am Boden und schau doch mal in [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner sturmfesten Steamgruppe[/url] vorbei, in der ich noch viele weitere Spiele vorstelle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014375509', 'num_games_owned': 1062, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 16324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16227, 'last_played': 1696109153}
review:
Gather a motley crew of barely adequate AI personnel or worse... actual humans then go up in a big balloon filled with highly flamnable gas carrying lots and lots of weapons that burn, shatter, cut and blow things up.

Then do onto others before they do onto you.

Sink your enemies, see them fly away from you, and hear the burning of their balloons! That is best in GOIO

-----

The Alliance expansion / update adds PvE. Basically you (and friends, if you have any) piloting or crewing ships versus an AI horde) with a strategic / meta map to provide focus and overall goals. Fight for your side to unlock more stuff for your ship.

review:
Played the original version as well and both games are really fun, especially with friends! I remember the PvP was really good back then! Haven't really played the PvE, but there are a lot of reviews regarding that here so check them out!

However as much as I love the game it doesn't have as many players as it deserves :( Really sad about it since this is a very fun and original concept! I would suggest you play it, but you'll probably only get to play PvE unless you gather a BIG group (at least 8 people would be cool).

It's also getting regular updates, albeit mostly cosmetics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968630995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 3240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1642218336}
review:
The game is all but completely dead. It should rather likely be called [i][b]"Chat Client of Icarus"[/b][/i] , because you're realisticly bound to spend [b]far more time[/b] waiting in lobbies with chatter going on, than experiencing any actually playing of the game itself..Puzzling enough, it seems to be a service that Steam Chat isn't currently fulfilling...
[h2]It's not commonly called [b][i]'Lobbies of Icarus'[/i][/b] without reason.. It is unfortunately turned into an [b]ICQ/MSN/FbChat alternative[/b] for the few core players, i'd guess..[/h2]

Waiting, sitting trough [b]15-30 minutes of lobby chatter, between each and every round[/b] of [i]actual[/i] gameplay is literarally not an uncommon experience..  Just saying.

But hey; Each to his own..

author: {'steamid': '76561198180202243', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1606428093}
review:
A phenomenal game. I’m sorry it’s not among the popular games on steam, this is a gem among co-op games.
The ships are very nicely and interestingly made, the weapons and maps are amazing to me.
This game is difficult to learn tactics, there are various ships, each has its advantages and disadvantages and it is great, never ending learning.
There are no toxic players at all, which is a huge plus, people support you in the game and when you are the worst, they teach you until you become the best. It is a very interesting community. If it weren't for one man in my friends, I don't think I would have ever played this game.
I recommend this game to everyone, it is worth every couple.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198069572324', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1600956211}
review:
[b]This is a very impressive and underrated game.[/b] Despite its repetitiveness, it offers a genuine challenge at higher levels, demanding a fine crew of human allies (or, if you lack friends, we have these lobotomized variants of friends called "bots"), as well as proper planning and strategy before and during the match, without being too overwhelming.

The only real flaws this game has are:

1. The playerbase is [i]very[/i] small (and always has been, surprisingly)

2. It's rather repetitive (although victory in even medium-end PvE and any PvP match demands real skill, not pattern recognition)

3. The challenge in coop mode comes more from the statistical difficulty of enemies than real, creative threats;

4. The bots are very much 'better than nothing' instead of true replacements for human companions, likely to reduce the odds of them being favored over humans.

Despite all this, especially at a $5 price, Guns of Icarus: Alliance is very, very worth giving a chance. You will, at the very least, get $5 worth of entertainment - and possibly much, much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053129075', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1593960710}
review:
[h1]Intro[/h1]
Best Sea of Thieves like game.
Undiscovered and hidden below a lot of [strike]shitty[/strike] average games on this platform.
[b]Guns of Icarus is one of the best to spend a good time with friends.[/b]
The game has PvP and PvE modes.
Gameplay is not very complicated. The hardest part is steering the ship and needs some time to get acquainted with it.
I especially recommend it for people who are into post-punk, fantasy or loves view of the ground from above.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Beautiful stylized graphics - a little bit east inspired.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Very addictive especially when playing together with friends. The gameplay is very dynamic during clashes.

[h1]Audience[/h1]
For everyone who wants to enjoy playing together.
Especially recommended for people who are into post-punk, fantasy or nice views.

[h1]Score[/h1]
8.5/10

[h1]The Problem[/h1]
The problem of the Guns of Icarus is small player base.[spoiler]I had not known about its existence before while I follow the game industry quite intensively.[/spoiler]
The game needs more love and better marketing because really deserves it.
Developers should focus on adding more relevant content rather than expanding the skins library but I understand that the popularity is too low to get more new unique content and really appreciate that the game is still supported by devs.

review:
This is truly one of the hidden gems of Steam. Imagine Sea of thieves arena and blackwake combined with an added steampunk fantasy element while flying airships ,  that is my best explanation. This is a unique, artistic game from a small studio, I am glad to support such great people.  Developers often play the game together with their players on the server and have fun with them.  Team voice squad is desirable in this game because this is primarily a team game, everyone has some role starting from pilots all the way to gunners and engineers.
Community is friendly small player base (but bigger with you here, perhaps) . I recommended this game to all my friends and good people, 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198097839842', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1667180604}
review: I have a million hours in Guns of Icarus Online. Alliance is a great co-op version which is great since the player base is very low.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054617875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1680307632}
review:
This is truly one of the hidden gems of Steam. I know that's been said in the reviews for this game already but I wanted to reiterate it because it's true. The Aesthetic of the game alone was enough to draw me to it but the game play is fast paced, the mechanics are easy to master, and it's a hell of a fun game to play with friends. I've been playing since before 'Alliance' came out and all the continued support is very encouraging for what this game could become in even a few years. I mus say, Guns of Icarus is one of my all-time favorite games.

Pros:
- Heat of the moment combat
- play with friends in private or public games
- game is still being updated
- very cheap, especially on sale
- beautiful game world and amazing steampunk art
- good community (at least the people I've met)
- ship's and characters are customizable aesthetically and mechanically.
- the main game modes are co-op but there's PvP available for you competitive friend groups.

Cons:
- small player base (but bigger with you here, perhaps)
- no campaign (there is lore though)
- game play can get repetitive
- not as fun without friends

Highly recommend. At the very least, a few rounds and some laughs with your friends should be worth your $4.99

author: {'steamid': '76561198362069431', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1692677475}
review:
online和alliance加起来30接近个小时的玩家,第一次写评测,这款游戏是直接吹爆
极为丰富的游戏体验,游戏性非常好:自定义飞艇,驾驶飞艇,炮台射击，维修船舰，PVP，PVE ,阵营战役，对于新手来说的游戏体验有点差，有射击,但不是特别考验FPS能力,对驾驶飞艇的舰长的要求可能比较高,虽然游戏服务器在国外,也可能是游戏人数少的缘故，裸连很少出现掉线之类的情况
在查阅了官方网站后，这个伊卡洛斯之炮的世界观等是真的可以吸引到想我样的家伙缺点是英语能力欠缺的人,还是有些难以游玩(我也是靠百度翻译个单词 个单词查的WEEEEEE NEEEEED CHINESE )
无论是与小伙伴们一起完成ALLIANCE里剧情的任务目标，还是与小伙伴们一起共同驾驶飞艇，进行飞艇之间的对抗，这款游戏非常适合(虽然我个人来说是没有朋友,只是个人游玩，泪目)
玩家船长到达8级(还是几级来着) PVP模式就解锁了所有舰船和炮塔
PVE的模式则似乎需要完成自己所属阵营的定等级，来解锁相应的船舰和炮塔(有些剧情模式的炮塔真的好炫酷啊啊啊啊啊啊
挺喜欢的，也不贵，入手一个真的不亏，如果有人陪着一起玩那就是血赚，以及这是我对这款游戏的玩法的介绍和游戏体验的视频：https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1jC4y1a7B1

author: {'steamid': '76561198291848926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1697924589}
review:
It's a good game. I haven't played in forever, and when I came back, I enjoyed the heck out of it.

I know some people say that it's dead, and indeed, active players at the same time rarely reaches 200, but honestly, with just 32 at the dead of night yesterday, I could have a blast. How? It's simple: If there are few players, there are few rooms, if there are many players, there are many rooms. The point is, the player count never drops to zero, and as long as it's not zero, there will be rooms to play in. The game doesn't feel dead at all when you are in a match, and believe me when I say this: There will always be a match.

review: Great PVP game to play with 24 or 32 of your acquaintances... if you can find that many people to do so. Everyone has an important role, and each one has a different gameplay beat. Piece together how to play the game from the tutorials (essential), the in-game UI (pretty but pretty bad), the wiki, and get advanced knowledge from the few veterans that still play it. Can't beat the price ($5) either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983284494', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1587820309}
review:
Игра классная, но онлайн PVP вообще никакой, а в нем то самый сок. 
Все играют PVE почему-то, хотя это в разы скучнее.
Я наиграл 40 часов еще в старую версию, где было одно PVP и это было в разы веселее и угарнее. Там была и атмосфера и стимул какой-то, а сейчас, если друзей нет на 2 команды, то и делать тут нечего. 

Отрицательный отзыв потому что разрабы не пытаются как-то поднять онлайн в игре, не делают рекламу. Да и вообще я посоветовал бы им перезапустить проект еще раз и добавить Русский язык , изменить прокачку (уж больно она убогая) и подтянуть графику и выпустить боевые пропуска и тд.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040546250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1587477877}
review:
Hanno creato un gioco con un'idea abbastanza avvincente.
Peccato che la pigrizia o fissazione degli sviluppatori sia quella esclusiva di aggiornare contenuti già esistenti, aggiungere elementi estetici e non so che altro di poco rilevante al game play pressoché identico da sempre.

I miei consigli:
Aggiungere sottotitoli di altre lingue cosi da capire nel proprio idioma tutto quello che c'è da sapere e rendere un player consapevole di quello che deve e non deve fare.
Aggiunta di modalità di gioco con nuove idee di base oppure di tendenza.
Aggiunta di sistema di combattimento tra giocatori (fanteria) con possibilità di abbordaggio e appropriazione della nave nemica.
Sistema di match making da rivedere per renderlo più efficace.

Per concludere sono sicuro che queste idee da me espresse avrebbero portato il prodotto a un risultato migliorato, convincente e quindi molto più apprezzato, venduto e giocato.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1585770740}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#374 out of 612)... it's time for Guns of Icarus Alliance.

You might, understandably, be forgiven for thinking Guns of Icarus Alliance is a single-player game, considering there is also a listing on Steam for Guns of Icarus Online. Actually, both listings are for the same game, which is entirely online. So, yeah, that's disappointing.

Speaking of disappointing, let's talk about the premise of the game. You might also be forgiven for thinking Guns of Icarus is an "airship combat game," but that's really only half the story. What the game is, rather, is a first-person co-op shooter that happens to be set [i]on[/i] airships. (Airships very clearly inspired by early Final Fantasy games.) This difference is key, I think. It's astonishing how incredibly versatile the medium of gaming is. You can play as literally anything—even, memorably, something as perfectly abstract as a gust of wind—yet the vast majority of games out there simply put you in the shoes of some dull human. How boring! In a game about airship combat, I'd at least like to, you know, play as an airship from time to time!

The basic structure of Guns of Icarus is pretty bog-standard. You're on a small airship and have one of three jobs: pilot, gunner or engineer. They're all rather self-explanatory. Your job is to either angle the ship so that the turrets' firing arcs reach your enemy, fire at the enemy, or repair damage. The only interesting thing is the conceit of being on a small airship instead of inside an arena, and I'd be lying if I said it wasn't fun leaping through the air from deck-to-deck, knowing that if the angle was off I'd careen overboard and fall down a very, very long way. But beyond the novelty of the premise? I'm not really seeing any reason to stick around. Seems like a fun time for co-op with friends, but otherwise? No thanks.

review:
Класна гра в стилі стім панк. Дуже атмосферна гра. Граю в неї давно. Одна така в своєму роді.
Все як у пісні Юркеша. Я капітан дережабля, у мене позолочена шабля... 
Такий собі один з перших бател рояль, літаючі ПВП кораблі вс літаючі кораблі. Є ПВЕ контент.
Також є стратегічно тактична складова захопленя ресурсів на карті. 
3 професії кеп, стрілець, інженер. у кожного свої скіли.
Безліч кораблів які потрібно компонувати певною зброєю залежно від типу батлу.
-Але дужеееее малий онлайн.
-Відсутність локалізації
-Джойстики нажаль не працюють

author: {'steamid': '76561198081606944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 9529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7092, 'last_played': 1697231518}
review:
Nawet dobra, jak ktoś chce się poczuć jak pilot sterowca to polecam.
Dobre sterowanie okrętem, trzeba trochę mieć wprawy z uwagi na rozmieszczenie dział i działek na określonych sterowcach.
Moim zdaniem wyśmienita akcja dużo się dzieje na sterowcu. nawet jak jest się pilotem jest dużo do obczajenia i pomocy dla załogi.
Moim zdaniem ta gra miała i ma dalej potencjał.
Fajna dla odprężenie i trochę do rozkminiania: czyli jakie pociski do jakich dział bo nie wszystkie nadają się dobrze do różnych broni no i jakie skile na jakie misje.
Ja się bawiłem wyśmienicie.
Polecam

author: {'steamid': '76561198372610871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2394, 'last_played': 1579884145}
review:
Отличная игра, аналогов которой очень мало, хорошее управление, оптимизация, низкие требования, приятная картинка и музыка. Отрицательных эмоций ничего не вызывает в этой игре, можно (и нужно) играть в команде из как минимум 3 человек (лучше 4), а можно играть одному и в команду дадут ботов.
Подходит для любителей максимально реалистичного управления техникой и ведения боев. На каждом дирижабле есть команда из 4 человек,  каждый из этих людей занимается своим делом, а конкретно:
Механик - чинит повреждения, следит за целостностью дирижабля, тушит пожары и вешает улучшения на движки, и защиту на корпус\пузырь. Может стрелять из пушек, но имеет всего 1 улучшение для стрельбы.
Стрелок - стреляет из пушек, имеет 3 дополнительных улучшенных режима стрельбы. Дополнительно может помогать в починке механику или тушить пожары, но придется выбирать что-то одно.
Пилот - пилотирует дирижабль, может выполнять по одной функции каждого из членов команды, но как правило времени у него на это нет.
Управление очень интересное, но легко привыкнуть, тут не получится зажать W и маневрировать. У каждого вида дирижаблей есть свои характеристики подвижности и прочности, а так же уникальное расположение пушек. Есть очень маневренные но легко бронированные, есть почти стационарные но тяжело бронированные, при любом варианте все дирижабли в управлении сложны т.к. моментально сменить направление полета невозможно даже с помощью перков. Как и стрельба точно в цель возможна только в упор, у каждого типа пушек и даже снарядов\патронов есть своя траектория и скорость полета, которую можно изменить с помощью перков, по этому приходится брать упреждение. 
Имбовых, или очень сильных дирижаблей нет, как и имбовых классов (хотя объективно стрелок редко когда оправдывает свои перки, по этому берут механиков), в игре баланс доведен до максимально возможного уровня, какой можно только вообразить при таком количестве перков и вооружения. 
Единственный минус этой игры - отсутствие какой либо адекватной рекламы. На игру можно только случайно натолкнуться, или узнать от друга (что маловероятно). В связи с чем в игре отсутствует онлайн, в самые топовые моменты на моей памяти было 1000 человек, в среднем в день 100-200 человек. 
При этом поиск игры происходит достаточно быстро, и разница в уровнях совсем не роляет в пвп.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343585591', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1578602021}
review:
Ни для кого не секрет, что в Guns of Icarus огромнейшая проблема с онлайном.

Это DLC должно было решить эту проблему если не полностью, то, хотя бы, частично.
Собственно, ставим вопрос, справилось ли оно со своей задачей?

И да, и нет.

С DLC пришли фракции, глобальная мировая карта, где фракции играют с монеточками, думая, где атаковать, а где защищать. (не путайте с открытым миром) Пришли и новые корабли, элементы кастомизации, в общем, косметика, которая призвана подчеркнуть в вас вашу индивидуальность. (А ведь она так нужна при таком количестве игроков!) В любом случае, приятный бонус.

Весь геймплей дополнения направлен на Co-op, то есть, воевать придется против ботов, что очевидно. Существуют различные миссии на 1, 2, 3 и даже 4 экипажа. То есть, ко-оп до четырех кораблей по четыре человека. А если меня чему-то и научила улица, так это арифметике! Четыре на четыре... Это будет так-с... Шестнадцать! Хороший такой кооператив. Задания тоже различаются. Где-то банальная атака стационарных целей, где-то их защита в разных форматах, привези-увези, убей, отрази волны, убей босса. Геймплей, в целом, не изменился. Так как это боты, то врагов вы встретите заметно больше. Много вам подобных экипажей, а ещё самолётики не дадут заскучать, а также не забудьте про стационарные структуры, некоторые из которых тоже не дадут себя в обиду. А на блюдечке с голубой каёмочкой ещё и босс прилетит под эпичную музыку, убийство которого зачастую необходимо. Зато за его убийство бонус дают! Кстати о бонусах, помимо бонусов существуют ещё специальные грузовые маленькие корабли, которые по своей сути безобидны, но за их уничтожение вы тоже получаете свои бонусы. Например, улучшенная выживаемость.

Вы закончили миссию? Поздравляю, вы получите опыт на классе, фракции и-и-и-и...Монетки! Неужели валюта, за которую можно покупать что-то интересное для себя? Почти. Это очки, которые нужно спускать на мировой карте, чтобы "финансировать" операции по защите или атаки, закупая туда солдат различных сортов или проводя другие махинации. Если не таить греха, то эта идея не доведена до ума, ибо скучна она как школьный КВН. Возможно, я просто должен был в себе разбудить патриота своей фракции, но нет фракции лучше, чем Единая Россия.

В любом случае, поиграться можно даже с одним другом в команде, оставив два места на корабле для ботов, отказавшись от прочих союзников. Вы всё так же будете получать опыт, монетки и всё такое, но геймплей может быстро надоесть. В этом кроется плюс своеобразной независимости от онлайна.

Обратная сторона состоит в том, что онлайн игры завис где-то на планке от 40 до 180 в среднем, в какие-то местные события, ясное дело, онлайн ещё выше поднимается, но согласитесь, что этого мало. А теперь тот онлайн, что есть в наличии, разделён на два лагеря: PvP и PvE. Найти живую душу для игры стало немного сложнее, хотя по личному опыту скажу, что быстрый поиск в PvE даже смог мне подобрать напарников и собранные экипажи.

Новые пушки и корабли, кстати, довольно интересные. И даже имеют некоторое преимущество перед стандартными кораблями, либо так просто кажется. Хотя, один корабль из PvE контента не пустили в PvP, ибо его характеристики были слишком... Выдающимися.

Последним пунктом отмечу, что в игру завезли неплохую музыку, в конце концов. Завезли временные и динамические топы игроков фракции, то есть, систему лидеров. (Лидеры играют некоторую роль на мировой карте) У фракций милый лор, хотя, субъективно, стиль мне их не особо понравился. Лору и фракциям нужно какое-то развитие. Разработчики до сих пор устраивают совместные игры с аудиторией, победителей вознаграждают предметами из магазина, часто на выбор победителя. А некоторые карты даже способны радовать глаз!

Если у вас есть лишние деньги, хорошие друзья, просто соскучились по Guns of Icarus или желаете поддержать разработчиков, которые до сих пор делают массаж сердца умирающему проекту, то рекомендую купить. Но таких как, возможно, вы, очень малый процент.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153734169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2813, 'last_played': 1614967490}
review: In Guns of Icarus you take a role in the airship and do your part. There are various ships to pick from, you learn how to be the most effective on your position as every ship has a different layout. Each ship also has a different role in the fleet, some carry more guns others are versatile and fast... The community of this game is really great. But its just 100 or less people active which means you wont have many big fleet battles. The cause of this small player base was mainly the developers course of action "(bad balancing") and doesn't reflect correctly the kind of fun and enjoyment this title can offer. Even so this is a fun to play game, with a small group of players but really friendly. Would recommend this game to anyone who wants to get it with his/her squad tho and not alone as he/she will have a hard time finding matches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075359250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 42, 'playtime_at_review': 87266, 'last_played': 1711325196}
review:
I have waited nearly seven years to write this review. Statistics are split between the original PVP-only mode and the PVE expansion released years later, so while my displayed time is 1,400 hours, the true number is closer to 4,000 hours. 

Guns of Icarus has contained my highest highs, and lowest lows of video gaming - and the truth of the matter is, I cannot recommend it to anyone. The gameplay in a vacuum is robust; the concept is strong and when achieved properly is a highly engaging and challenging experience that leads to a sense of camaraderie with other players rarely possible in other games. Unfortunately this experience is /entirely/ reliant on a community vast enough to homogenize the average skill level to a point where disparity is easily managed. As it stands now, and has for multiple years, the community is barren - limited to a die-hard few and an oblivious fewer that rarely if ever leads to a sense of progress or purpose for new players to experience. A jaded vet community that actively dissuades inexperience and a tonedeaf developer that consistently tugs at my heartstrings with the potential for greatness tires my soul of this video game. No amount of developer and community stat-fiddling is going to accelerate the /core paradigms/ of Guns of Icarus - the only thing that will achieve that is community. Muse has a communications issue when it comes to expressing how their game is played and what to expect when joining for the first time. This game desperately needed a single player campaign mode that more comprehensively expressed the mechanics before burdening others with their inexperience - I use the past tense because it is much, much too late for this. 

While I could expound on a plethora of other technical issues with this video game, I feel that it is unnecessary - I believe a majority of these things will /never/ be updated and it is much more pertinent to what players will actually experience to focus on the aspects that keep the game running, or not running as it currently stands. It's a shame to finally admit - as a player that has been here from the very start - that I will never suggest this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009618175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 3196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2628, 'last_played': 1676942372}
review: Wonderful game that has a small group of players left. It says I have played for 43 hours only but this is incorrect. Not sure why. I've been playing since 2012 and have a few hundred games played. Great PVP (No one left playing really though) and fun PVE (great with friends). Just be aware that there are few players still playing. Devs are wonderful and still releasing content and updates. They love this game and their community. If you have 1 to 3 friends to play with this game is the best. Pro tip, AI will respond to commands and will also move to dedicated rolls with F1-F3 keys. Makes it easier if you don't have a full crew and are the captain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032387023', 'num_games_owned': 1899, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1574607123}
review:
Despite its good aspects, at its core, Guns of Icarus is not a good game. It offers a nice steampunk setting with interesting ship models and co-op play. You can customize your ship, weapons, items and get into battle with a variety of options to choose from. You get to play either the captain, gunner or engineer, but you are not limited to the actions of your class. The main problem with Guns of Icarus is that the gameplay mechanics are (despite looking complicated at first sight) very bare bones and consequently the game gets boring really fast. It also doesn’t help that the PVE mode is not really fun and PVP servers are on life support. 

When playing Guns of Icarus, you can’t help but feel that this should have been a great game. Unfortunately, when the steampunk mask wears off, you are left with dull gameplay.

[b]5.5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198012445109', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1564458191}
review:
Unfortunately I can't recommend this game anymore. Though there is a fantastic game system under the hood here, a multiplayer game ultimately is only as good as its community. For Guns of Icarus, the community has run away to other games, and what remains is incredibly toxic.

I had the opportunity to play with a dev from Muse games, who unfortunately was also one of these incredibly toxic players, who heckled me on voice chat and continuously yelled at me to quit. Sure, I'll quit. It's not like I owe Muse anything to keep playing the game.

The only way to enjoy Guns of Icarus nowadays is to get it with a friend group that is a perfect multiple of 4 and never play a public game, just run some missions co-op with each other. In that scenario, the game really shines. Otherwise, the game you wish you could be playing doesn't exist. The community's a drag, and clearly Muse itself doesn't even care.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054864756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 43480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16375, 'last_played': 1702788805}
review:
This game is old. It's population hovers around 50 these days, nowhere near the height of it's former glory and definitely not able to keep up with all the fancy new Multiplayer competitors ... and yet, time and again, I and many others find ourselves still coming back to it every week because it's team-based mechanics simply are not easily found anywhere else. New players still float in every now and again, and old timers happily teach them new tricks when they meet. Saturday evenings are a great time for getting in and enjoying the rare 8 ship PVP lobby due to the CHAOS community event, and there is still almost always a lobby or two going at other times - even without other online players, the PVE mode is a decent bit of fun all it's own or with a small group of friends ploughing through missions gunning, fixing and outrunning the impending fleet.

It's a game that rewards coordination, experimentation, guts and patience all the same and one day I hope it gets a true make over because it's some of the most fun I have had over the years.
