author: {'steamid': '76561198104354657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8758, 'last_played': 1532177348}
review:
A true 0/10. 

They got double their kickstarter goal for this expansion ($200,000) yet delivered virtually nothing.

The co-op is not even a concept game. It's just some hacked together garbage by one of the most incompetent, and lazy dev teams to ever exist.

.

The original PVP is still worth trying though, it's actually cool, and there is no other game like it.

review:
This is a real multi-player game as you will lose when you don't play as a team.
It really helps when you have a good captain who will tell which player has to care for which parts of the ship.

Also the community is small but nice. They are very welcoming to newcomers and introduce you instead of screaming at you. 

I recommend this game to anyone who likes teamplay and I hope some people will join to increase the community as this game deserves more activity.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992029891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1570648559}
review:
Player base = 29 people at a peak European time. around 19:00
All 29 people have Golden items which basically give them an advantage over you as they repair faster, do more damage, move faster than yourself with regular items. So you will never win. 
Then the clincher there was just one open lobby which took 20+ minutes before a game occurred within said lobby. This then quickly turned to a "private game" where there was a total of 2 private game lobbies with no one prepared to give the password out to anyone that wasn't a veteran player.

TLDR - do not buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811248435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1549956811}
review:
DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
I've played about 60 hours between this and the base game, so i'm hardly what i would call a veteran, but then i consider a vet 600-1000+ in a good game. There's a lot to love about this game, and a lot to hate about it, namely lack of boarding, cancerous playerbase ect. I liked much of the combat and it was fun to play with 3-4 of my friends casually so i even avoided most of the *%^#%$#% of the limited playerbase, however this game lacks far too much especially content to keep one playing. my review might be somewhat different if the devs weren't too lazy to balance bard (the gist of their statement why they wont add it) boarding would add so much to this game but without it even in the best context this game has little to offer.

Now to the main reason why i dont recommend this game, simple. Airmen exists, it has everything this game needs and more including a although single very dedicated dev who consistently brings out good enjoyable content, and it is bearly affected by playerbase.

I applaud the Devs for this game for sticking with it as long as they did and trying to encourage new payers, but even giving away this game for free wasn't enough to ensnare or keep new players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3722, 'playtime_forever': 7416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2777, 'last_played': 1645176922}
review:
这个游戏真的让我感到非常失望。首先，游戏的图形实在是太过简陋了。角色和环境的细节几乎没有，而且整个游戏的画面都显得非常模糊。我真的无法理解为什么开发者没有花更多的时间和精力来提升游戏的视觉效果。

玩法方面，这个游戏也让我感到非常乏味。你只需要控制一个飞艇，在空中与其他玩家或NPC战斗。但是问题是，战斗的方式非常单一，缺乏策略性。你只需要不停地点击鼠标来射击敌人，完全没有任何深度可言。这让我很快就对游戏失去了兴趣。

音效方面也是一团糟。背景音乐乏味无聊，而且音效效果非常低劣。枪声听起来像是从一个廉价的玩具枪中发出的，根本没有真实感。这让整个游戏的氛围变得非常逊色，让人根本无法沉浸其中。

最令我气愤的是，游戏中经常出现各种各样的BUG和故障。有时候我会突然卡在墙壁里，或者游戏会突然崩溃。这让我感到非常沮丧，觉得游戏的质量非常低劣。

总的来说，Guns of Icarus Alliance是一个令人失望的游戏。图形简陋，玩法乏味，音效糟糕，BUG和故障频繁。我真心不建议任何人去玩这个游戏，因为它完全没有任何乐趣可言。

author: {'steamid': '76561198050827151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 29176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8434, 'last_played': 1578678643}
review: You will find around 30-40 players every day, and 70-80 during the weekend (at least that is what I found during the summer break). Also, you can create and play the single player mod flying with bots. Very enjoyable game when you get to know every ship, gun and the ammo needed for each gun. This game is easy to learn as you switch between different classes. At one point you will find yourself playing on Veteran or Hell difficulties because hard becomes normal after a while. I absolutely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121820552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1564618556}
review:
HOLY COW! Just buy the game, and get your friends to play. They have new PvE game modes-- 100% makes it worth returning to. And since there's such a small dedicated player base right now, it's easy to land yourself on the leaderboards. 

My advice? Pick a class and STICK with it. Get good at it. You're gonna blow slime at first, but after you get the hang of things, you'll find out what load-outs work best for which modes on which ships. It helps if you stick with crews during match-making (even if they are a little green), because you'll synergize after a few matches together. 

Biggest take away? Don't give up! You'll lose a lot of matches at the start, but don't be discouraged for long. You'll meet those couple of players that love playing the game and playing their rolls and it'll click. Next thing you know you'll be storming every game mode on Hard like a mad lad.

Could not recommend enough!!!

PROS:
-Passionate, small community
-PvE and PvP available
-Faction games available
-EASY controls
-Pretty graphics
-Simple UI
-FUN! YOU'RE IN A GOSH-DARNED AIRSHIP! WEEEEE!

CONS: 
-Steep learning curve
-You can't be a jack-of-all-trades
-You have to work with people (--which is an ew for some people)
-Hard to find matches if you only play one mode
-Can get a bit laggy if you're hooked to a server outside your geographic locale
-Some people like to quit mid-match if there aren't any high-levels on board

author: {'steamid': '76561198150560128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 5488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3527, 'last_played': 1660552863}
review:
Travail d'équipe et bonne compréhension des stats des armes nécessaire pour maximiser les chances de réussite.

J'aime ce jeu mais le seul point qui est dommage c'est qu'il y a peu de joueur sur les serveurs. J'ignore si c'est parce que je passe par steam ou bien qu'il faut prendre le jeu directement sur leur site officiel.

N'empêche le jeu continue à fournir du contenus. Ils tiennent bon ces gens-là.

Le jeu coûtait cher en magasin à l'époque. Là, son prix à bien descendu depuis.

Vous aurez surement du mal à trouver un match public dû au manque de joueur. Le mieux c'est que vous créez vous même un matchmaking et d'attendre qu'un ou plusieurs joueurs vous rejoignent en partie ou en salon. Perso, vous avez + de chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150166156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1604699715}
review:
Great game to play whenever you want or to pick up again after some time. Combine teamwork and tactics to destroy your enemies (but a little bit of luck also helps). Over time you can gain user experience and knowledge of the weapons and ships and use that to design your ideal ship loadouts or keep it interesting by mixing it up from time to time.

Personally I find the biggest cons the lag (depending on your device and internet connection) and the lack of players (which is less an issue when playing against AI, but could become boring and PvP is also a lot of fun).
I enjoy it the most when playing with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358356377', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1939, 'last_played': 1666773672}
review:
So I sort of have a fetish for indie or not so well known games. Usually with these titles they are a hit and miss for me. Yet this game (after watching some preview videos) had so much going for it (co-op, interesting setting, cool looking gameplay) that I was in shock over how bad it was and it forced me to write a review to warn other gamers about this game.

Story:

Literally there is none it is the future and instead of boats, cars, airplanes, or trains people trade their goods over blimp like contraptions that look like a huge ark tied to a huge zeppelin. Yet the problem is there are pirates attacking them so that's where you come in. You are a no named pilot who (oddly doesn't need to steer his blimp) must defend his cargo and repair specific areas to make sure you make it to your destination A-okay. 


Gameplay:

Basically this is a defense game where you have to make sure your ship makes it to its destination in good condition. There are 2-5 areas of the ship that you can manually repair and a nice amount of stationary weapons all over the ship to send those nasty pirates back where they came from. Now I know this sounds like an interesting concept and I know I thought it did. I mean here is a pretty decent sized ship, cool looking stationary guns, and infinite ammo how can this game go wrong? well it somehow manages to screw up all the appealing features.

The first problem right off the back is the controls ohh the controls. Now if you want to turn around or strafe you need to use the mouse. Now imagine hitting either right arrow or the "d" key to move to the right like in most PC games not in this game. Instead it physically turns your character to face the right side. Now I wish I could describe it better and I can't the control scheme is all off. 

Another problem is the weapons. Now I don't know if its the placement of the weapons or what they exactly do..probably the combination of the both. So there is different variants of guns on your deck. Yet they just don't feel powerful or just seem useful against the pirate ships. One example is a chaingun looking thing. So you are like "cool a chain gun I can totally wipe those pirates out within a minute." Well no this HAS to be the slowest chain gun in the history of videogames. It is very slow firing and it even has a short ammo clip.You have to upgrade it after levels,but still not that useful. Another gun is a BIG turret/rocket launcher thing. Now once again you are like "epic since the chain gun sucks lets see the rocket launcher." Well sadly its pretty useless. The rockets move way too slow to even scratch the pirate ships.Another gun is a massive electricity gun that can take out a big horde, but it takes too long to charge. Also in terms of placement some guns are in very useful areas while most aren't.

Finally the biggest problem with this game is it made mostly for the multiplayer. The ship is too big and there are too many attackers for single player. You could be fighting a whole pirate horde on the right side of the ship only to see 1000 more on the left attacking your ship. There are 2-5 spots where you can repair your ship in specific areas (like the cargo hold,zepplin,engines) but if you are by yourself its too much from fighting to repairing its just overwhelming.

Multiplayer:

Could be fun if someone was on it. See the biggest reason I wanted this game was for some Co-op fun I think it could handle anywhere between 4-8 players (don't quote me on that though) and to my dismay there was only 1 other player with me. We played a round but I just couldn't have a fun time there is a lack of communications (we couldn't type to each other the game doesn't support it or never told either of us how to) and the game went from over whelming to too easy. We easily managed the pirate horde with our horrible weapons. Yet another map we were totally overrun with pirates and lost. I think it was from both the weapon type and placement of the weapons on the ship. It was just a very bad experience definitely not like the gameplay videos. 

Graphics:

Now I am not a graphics whore. I really don't expect a lot from indie developers in the graphics department. Yet this game is just awful to look at. The sky literally looks like a large dirty blue sheet of paper that had drawings of clouds on them. I can not express the ugliness of the game and once again not what was advertised. (PS I can play most games on high with my PC this game was on the highest setting and to my dismay looked horrible.)Also you can play this game on a web browser..so you can imagaine how great they must look.

Audio:

Guns sound like guns engines sound like engines it was the least I could hope for.

Pro's

Interesting concept, could have some fun co-op moments, the ship looks cool and you can customize and upgrade it.

Con's

Bad graphics, bad controls, the online mode is horrible, can barely play single player, Once you buy it the game is yours forever you can't return it, can't chat with your partner in multiplayer, the placement of weapons,no one plays online,just really disappointing.

Overall:

This really surprised me in a bad way I really expected a fun time with this game. I really dislike this game if I could I would somehow someway return it but I can't do that since its a digital download title. This seriously gives a VERY bad name to both digital download titles and indie developers. If anyone reads this and thinking about this game just don't it really is for co-op and there is literally no one on this garbage and for good reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978865617', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1660361985}
review: This game is a lot of fun.  It is created in a Steam Punk style and requires close teamwork with at least 3 or more friends.  There are AI bots to take the places of friends if you do not have enough friends to play with, but the bots are dumb and don't do near good enough job so it is always best and the most fun to play with friends.  The ships are balloons, but so much more.  You must have a pilot who is good at organizing the crew and flying the ship.  You need great engineers to keep the ship flying while you fight the enemy and you need gunners to do the shooting.  You can pick from several ships at the start of the game, but more are unlocked as you level up.  You can play with one or more teams against a common enemy, or against each other...and there are a lot of different types of missions you can play.  The over all game is very well made and runs well even on my duel core computer.  I highly recommend it.

review: This PVE expansion allows you to develop  the skills that make this skill based game fun. It is a pity that this facet of the game didn't come out first. The points you win feed in to an interesting strategic game as well. Once you feel confident in the PVE game, duking it out against AI steam punk ships, you can grab some friends and try your hand at the PVP game. Well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223597332', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2727, 'last_played': 1709844538}
review: Jeu très innovant, on voit rarement des jeux multijoueurs de ce style. Le travail d'équipe est vraiment important, et une partie ou on arrive à se coordonner parfaitement avec ses membres d'équipages et ceux des autres navires est toujours très satisfaisante. Les développeurs sont très actifs ajoutant du contenu régulièrement et organisant des évenements. La communauté, quoi que très réduite, est géniale et prête à aider les nouveaux joueurs. Bref, un bon jeu indé, qui ne mérite que d'être plus connu et apprécié!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118403230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1585606490}
review:
Oggi è una calda giornata di Giugno. Dovrei uscire, lavorare, fare una vita dignitosa, ricca di esperienze utili. Dovrei viverla, questa vita, questi anni così importanti. Ma invece sono qui, su Guns of Icarus Alliance, un gioco morto anni fa. 
Riparo una nave di cui essenzialmente non importa nulla, mentre i miei amici combattono una battaglia inutile.
Guardo il deserto sulla terra e penso alla mia anima, che non esiste. Vorrei poter smettere di pensare e combattere la mia guerra come ognuno dei membri delle navi che ha sorvolato queste terre, ma non riesco.
Quando troverò la forza, mi butterò. Sperando che non ci sia un dopo, sperando di non respawnare nuovamente su questa orribile nave.

author: {'steamid': '76561198956895280', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1621361486}
review:
Guns of Icarus is a PvP game that has you and other teammates controlling a steampunk style airship while taking down other players. There are some good things about this game. The customisation options available for your character and ship are rather extensive, for example the hat of the mad hatter from Alice in Wonderland and even after being out for several years the graphics for the game are pretty good and the game could most likely run on lower end computers and if you did manage to get into a game with a decent amount of people you would get to work as a team to take down the enemies which is rather enjoyable.

Although due to a lack of players it becomes very boring very quickly. During my time playing it I never actually got into a game as all the lobbies had a few players but not enough to start the game. Even fighting against bots in practice mode became boring as you could only fight one on one and you had to take the role of captain which stops you from trying out the other classes because you will get blasted to smithereens as the bots won't pilot the ship themselves. although this was fun to begin with it soon became boring as the bot was rather easy to defeat.

Overall i would not recommend this game unless you have a large group of friends to play a private match with because you would spend more time trying to join a game than you would playing it, also fighting bots in fun for about half an hour but it soon becomes repetitive as you are fighting the same bot over and over. Back in the day this game was full of players and it is rather sad to see it empty now as this game was full of life a few years back. I think that it is better to save your money and wait until you find a game that is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062013177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1559959663}
review:
Less of a thumbs down for the game, more for the so many  idiots that play it.
Like last years expression "You can't fix stupid", you can't fix idiots that constantly mouth off or are 30 yet are as immature as a 9 year old latchkey kid.

Game concepts like this usually fall flat with random pickup groups because sadly for the human race, a higher percentage of gamers are morons that don't know their arse from their elbow, have little awareness outside of themself, think they funny as George Carlin, and don't give two #$%@ to want to play as a team even though success depends on it. 

Same with the battlefield games, or anything that has a squad, etc., that would benefit greatly from a team effort. Maybe works one out of ten times when you end up with group of people with an IQ of at least 80 and don't have a AH personality.
Only really works when you are in some kind of guild/clan that regularly play together.

And normally as part of the problem I'd turn off voice chat but it's an essential part of the game.

Maybe someday someone somewhere will apply machine learning to the game design. Something to automatically group the idiots together so they are isolated, then group the other non-toxic sensible players that are at least trying to play as a team..

author: {'steamid': '76561198079482596', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1527707812}
review: This game will always have a special place in my heart. I have so many fond memories of this game (both this and the original), I would always play for a couple hours, and then get back on to scratch that itch. It got so bad one day I literally passed out at helm piloting and had to get off. I loved everything, expect maybe the roleplayers and people who played Squidd. Sadly it's totally dead. Maybe if you and the boys, all 8 (16 will also work fine) of you wanted to play this, I'd say shoot so you can create your own custom lobby. This game is totally unique in a lot of mechanics and it always feels like SOMETHING is going on. But it's probably not worth getting it just by yourself. Cause getting into a game seems impossible from what I've tried, and they're all probably hyper maxed on everything the game has to offer

the game is actually pretty good if you have fun teammates but otherwise this isn't worth the purchase

author: {'steamid': '76561197966468894', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1551415371}
review:
TBH I'm not even sure what the exact mechanical relationship is between this and Guns of Icarus:Online but I was in "Online" and I think it said I need Alliance to play co-op, so I bought this for like ~$2.50 on sale.

I've owned Online for a long time and I'm a bit sorry I waited this long to check it out. That's the best testimonial I can give! :) It's got depth and nuance beyond what i was expecting.

I believe that in part it comes from simply splitting up the operations of the ship into a 4-person crew. In "other games", a lot of these "crew activities" might be something u hit one button for, and it happens in an abstract way "offscreen" and magically your ship is repaired. Turning every simple activity into something that an actual crew needs to coordinate actually causes interesting, fun, and intense gameplay to emerge.

I can vouch that there is a small but active, and friendly, helpful playerbase.

It seems you can learn most of the mechanics in PvE, to your heart's content, (which u can even play totally single-player, with bots,) but MP was my destination.

Most of the PvP activity I have seen is in EU which gives me a 100-120ms ping from "US East" but the higher latency is much more tolerable in this game than it would be in an unforgiving FPS like CS or CoD-whatever.

Even at times when I have hosted my own matches, people have joined pretty quickly.

For what it's worth also, normally I would say "beware" when entering a competitive fps-like game late in its lifecycle, because you're going to be playing w/ all the old pros, etc. But, for example, I played a match where, based on numeric levels, at least, the teams appeared "stacked" and I thought we were going to lose pretty bad. Also, I actually had been on the opposing pilot's crew and I knew he was good, commanding the team w/ mic, piloting very well (which includes knowing what you're working w/ afa guns etc. -- the technical details of the other stations of the ship!), etc. And I was going up against him as a pilot, now. Long story short: we lost 4-5 and it could have easily gone either way. Once we were in-match, the "skill difference" (for lack of better term) kinda disappeared (in ways), just due to the fact that any one "elite" player's impact is going to be distilled because they are 1/4 of a crew. Also, the match was 2 ships vs 2 ships, so ... there's just a chaos factor there that's hard to describe but Von Moltke's famous adage "no battle plan survives contact w/ the enemy" comes close. ;)

Anyway yeah I've played like 3 pvp games so I could easily show up next time and get crushed but ... that's my impression at this point.^

review:
Its an alright game, but the developers stole money from their kickstarters and steam purchasers with their first title. They promised this game, and delivered a single player beta version of this game with 2 'missions' and no way to actually win, since you had to operate everything solo. They then abandoned the project, hid the game on steam, and went on to great acclaim with this game. If you don't believe me, look up "Flight of the Icarus", which was originally called Guns of Icarus.

They're thieves, and you should know that before you support them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 4640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1688171797}
review:
I got this game for free during a Humble Bundle giveaway bit over a year ago, and jumped in having no idea waht I was getting myself into. I quickly found my place as a pilot, flying a tank/defense ship known as the Junker. Naming it the Skyfarer's Hope, I ventured on to get myself into the faction politics. Now, a year later, I'm a known member of the community, with actons of mine appearing in official lore. My next goals here? Get my name into lore, and become a better pilot. 

An amazing game. The game strongly revolves around cooperative gameplay with your crew. It is not very mechanically dificult, the difficuly arises more around strategy and coordination with other players. It can take a while to learn but once you get the basics and play with an experienced crew it's the most fun game experience.

One of the few competative multiplayer games i've played that actually requires communication and cooperation. 

Advice to new players: Try to log in during peak american or european hours and you will probobly be able to find a friendly captain who will be able to guide you (after you've finished the tutorial offcourse :p).

author: {'steamid': '76561198111215923', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 10107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9741, 'last_played': 1574626763}
review:
Updated: Jan 4 @ 1:43pm

I like to call myself a veteran of this masterpiece of a game. It's a sad story.

Started off so fun, so strong, but lack of true content (A few maps every now and then, but it just felt like it wasn't going anywhere) made me stop playing (Along side some rather political statements made from the mod of their Discord server).

PROS: * The gameplay is amazing from 3 different roles to play. Each with their own purpose and ability. Gunners get all sorts of ammos and reload faster with better aiming using their ability. Engineers get all sorts of tools to fix and prevent damage (Or increase the use of parts) of the ship, able to sprint across the ship (The only one who can). While the Pilot (my favorite one) gets alot of tools to use on the ship, at the cost of the parts on the ship (Sorry engineers!). They are also able to manipulate their turning and speed using their ability.

and, we have an entire selection of PVE missions, maps, factions, and each faction having a unique boss!

* A huge selection of ships, guns, ammos, and tools. Allowing all sorts of combos of ships in their own right. A slow scout ship with a huge sniper ship waiting in the dust for the scout to find a target for them. Two fast dog fighter ships charging into battle together to quickly wipe out one ship. Perhaps you prefer a more hit and run style, they got that too. This game has all sorts of ways to play that it never really gets all that boring to actually play. 

* Customizations. Hats, clothing, colors, themes, decals on the side of your balloons. It's a small plus but still one regardless

* The final pro of this game, the music. The music in this game is art, literal art. It was the first soundtrack I bought on purpose. 

MIDDLE GROUND: * It's progression system feels like total ship! (See what I did there?) along with a huge amount of "Achievements" it just feels like I DON'T feel like I achieve anything in this game. There is a bright side. This means all ships, all weapons, can be unlocked nearly instantly. Allowing any combo (Back to the pros!) of any ship and any weapons you want.

CONS: * Dead player base. It hurts me to say that, it really does. This game is such a niche genre on its own right though. SO it is slightly expected to be this way. 

* Lack of real content besides maps. Other than the "Expansion" Alliance, there has not been a serious content patch. 

It hurts me, it really does. It's like seeing your best friend fall on his face over and over again. You wanna cry but you laugh just a bit. Then you stop laughing. Cause he stops getting back up. You try to help him up too, buying the game for all your friends just hoping a few will try to stay and play. Then you walk away. Realizing its over. 

I love this game, I do. It hurts me to thumbs the game down. All cause of a dead or dying player base

game wise? 9.5/10

It was good knowing you GOI. It really was o7

author: {'steamid': '76561198046196842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 133330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 738, 'playtime_at_review': 36060, 'last_played': 1712356975}
review:
An amazing game. The game strongly revolves around cooperative gameplay with your crew. It is not very mechanically dificult, the difficuly arises more around strategy and coordination with other players. It can take a while to learn but once you get the basics and play with an experienced crew it's the most fun game experience.

One of the few competative multiplayer games i've played that actually requires communication and cooperation. 

Advice to new players: Try to log in during peak american or european hours and you will probobly be able to find a friendly captain who will be able to guide you (after you've finished the tutorial offcourse :p).

review: I got this game for free during a Humble Bundle giveaway bit over a year ago, and jumped in having no idea waht I was getting myself into. I quickly found my place as a pilot, flying a tank/defense ship known as the Junker. Naming it the Skyfarer's Hope, I ventured on to get myself into the faction politics. Now, a year later, I'm a known member of the community, with actons of mine appearing in official lore. My next goals here? Get my name into lore, and become a better pilot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409605655', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1563660284}
review:
TL;DR: GoI Alliance is a bit like its steampunk theme: looks clunky and pointless, but can be pretty awesome. Not great for long playtime, but it's really fun to pop on with friends and goof around for a bit.

The summary:
The game is designed around 4-player co-op, bots provided if necessary, and has you and your team crew an airship, with three classes of pilot, engineer, and gunner. Pilot directs the flying chaos that is your airship, gunner shoots stuff, and engineer tries to keep the whole mess afloat. The nice thing about the classes is that while each class specializes in their task, they can assist the other classes if need be. Everyone can shoot, repair, or fly, the only difference is equipment perks. You have a choice between whether you want to play PvP or play some specialized missions, and you can join a larger faction to claim territory as a team, which adds a nice overarching objective. Oh, you can also unlock different parts to build your own airship so you can have whatever odd combination of model, guns, and paint you feel like. And if you don't like the cosmetics the store has on offer, go vote for better ones in the workshop!

The specifics:
Graphics are cartoony but good, the game runs without bugs as far as I can tell, music is on point (and available as DLC if you need it), and the gameplay is pretty fun. The one complaint I have is that the game isn't as intrinsically rewarding as others due to an arcade-y feel to it, but that's easily remedied with friends or chill teammates. Character/ship cosmetics available for (cash) purchase, but definitely nowhere near necessary to enjoy the game or get an edge.

TL:DR: Part 2:
Get it if you want a casual online meetup game, grab it on sale if you're not that interested.

Fun fact: The devs host a  battle between them and the players every so often, if you beat them you get free stuff.

Warning to would-be engineers: Ships get set on fire. A LOT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359683656', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1559973525}
review: Oyun öncelikle süper ötesi ve çok eğlenceli. Arkadaşlarınız bir geminiz oluyor ve bu gemide bir arkadaşınız kaptan bir arkadaşınız tamirci bir arkadaşınız ateşci ve biri de yardımcı mürettebat oluyor. Bu gemiler aslında uçak ama bu uçaklar gemi şeklinde tasarlanmış. Her farklı işçinin farklı levelleri var. Örneğin kaptanın leveli arttıkça daha iyi bir geminiz oluyor. Bir takımda 4 gemi oluyor. Ve 2 takım savaşıyor. Toplam 4 gemi 4 mürettebat 16 arkadaşa kadar oynanabiliyor. İndirimde 3 tl ye kadar düşüyor. Kesinlikle alın derim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964096634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2633, 'last_played': 1684341947}
review:
Over the years in development hell Alliance became just a pale shade of what was originally planned for the addon!
Repeative PvE missions and a goddamn awful "conquest system", where you grind missions with your enemies on the same ship to gain progress for your faction...and theirs... Thats it.

Where was the open world approach lost? We wanted that, not this crap.
How is it possible, that the single developer of Airmen could pull off most of the stuff we wanted to see in the GOI addon as the sole dev and in much less time? 
Sorry, but Muse should feel ashamed. So many missed opportunities.

Check out Airmen's Expedition mode and tell me that something like this wasnt possible for GOI.
Sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118119742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 173877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 162, 'playtime_at_review': 61616, 'last_played': 1712198063}
review:
(GoI Online is PvP, GoI Alliance is both PvP w/ same servers and PvE)
You can grab this game really cheap, either during a sale or when they have an occasional free giveaway, so you'll get your value out of it. 

People's enjoyment of this game basically relies on if they are willing to communicate, whether it be voice or text chat, because communication is crucial when you're new in order to learn how to improve and become an effective member of a crew. 

What really makes this game is the customization and the deep, skill-based gameplay without any P2W or oppressive meta. The player count is pretty small during the quiet hours of the day but on weekends or during events you'll get a more healthy number of people. Mostly, events occur on Friday->Monday and vary between tournaments to 32-player matches with wacky rulesets such as using just "laser" guns. Event info can be easily found ingame in the Community tab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161396032', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1700088728}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018450069', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1541227809}
review:
I received the game for free in an offer campaign few months ago and, although I tested it at that time, was not enough to me to be able properly evaluation it. Now I have dedicated a little more, but I noticed a low number of players, which is sincerely regrettable.

In our days more and more games exist with multiplayer content, and the problem to those titles that are "multiplayer only" is, if they are not extremely good, the player base move on.

The game concept is very nice, and the visuals are good, especially if we think its a 2012 title. The mechanics are easy to catch and the experience in-game could be very nice if you play with a nice team, that guide you at start with what you need to do. 

But it's a declining game, unfortunately. I believe that, if converted free to play could bring some new players, and perhaps justify the few more hours of gameplay. But for now, as it is, I don't believe I'll. 

Anyway deserves my consideration, for the original idea above all else. So it will have my thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1537921524}
review:
Guns of Icarus Alliance, I liked this. I did not play it nearly as much as I played the base game, but Alliance did add some cool things to the game, like more ships and weapons, more ways to play, etc. The base game was updated as well, and is much changed since it first came out.

 The biggest issue with Guns of Icarus Alliance is the player count, it is extremely small/ As of typing this, the player count was at 16 in game. That being as it is I would only recommend the game if you had a good sized group of friends who also wanted it.  I do hope however we do get a well made Guns of Icarus sequel or spinoff some day, it seems like it could be a great universe to explore.


Base Guns of Icarus review: https://steamcommunity.com/id/Kodyd194/recommended/209080

author: {'steamid': '76561197992823470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2531, 'last_played': 1631245284}
review:
TLDR; Some of the reviewers here have either racked up their hours in the game staring at the main menu or simply belong in a 'home'.

The game itself is 7/10 [i]if[/i] you are into this style of game play. That is multicrewed vehicle co-op.

--------------------------------

[i](This review is rambling, disjointed,  and spur of the moment. I may or may not come back and clean it up later. I was inspired to post one quickly just because of how some of the "Most Helpful" reviews came from people who seemingly never actually played the game.)[/i]

Solid game, but not without its flaws. The biggest of which is the grind. This just simply isn't a style of game that works well with having a heavy grind. Having skills, items, and ships locked behind "Play X matches with (insert faction here)" gets to be pretty tedious when each match can take up to 30 minutes.

Reading through some of the reviews for the game though I was rather surprised to see how many of the them apparently never even bothered to click the "Create Match" button (some with dozens of hours!) and hop on out here to claim that "You need (insert insane number of players here) to even play the game!!!".

That is [i]completely[/i] wrong. A single match takes anywhere from 1 to 16 players across a max of 4 ships. Any empty crew slots on a ship are taken over by (very capable) AI. As an example, a group of 4 players can decide to each fly their own ship, all be on a single ship, or anything in between.

And yes, again, you can very easily play alone. The AI crew [i]will not hold you back[/i]. They're actually better than most of the random players that you'll come across. As long as you tell them what to do with the quick commands.

As far as the gameplay goes? It's pretty solid. The ships are very different from each other, so choosing one to suit your style goes beyond just "How many guns does it have". Handling, what types of guns can it mount and how many, the layout, engines, etc are all things that you can consider to find one that suits your play style.

The weapons are as equally varied. There is everything from a minigun that is effectively a point and click to cannons where the gunner has to consider their own speed, target's speed, distance, and relative movement. The weapons also inflict different types of damage. Some are great at starting fires, other are great at stripping off armor, and some are well suited for popping the ever so critical balloon.

The mission types are... OK. They're fun, but they aren't quite enough of them to suit my tastes. They effectively boil down to "Defend", "Kill Everything", and "Go Here". Which, in the context of airship combat is certainly fun, but after a while it leaves me wishing from something more.

The sound and music are good. Just by listening you can tell what weapons are being fired, what the captain is doing with the engines, and so on. And the music is certainly fitting. I can't really expand on the music too much as I never listen to a game's music as I prefer my own. But, don't take that as a hit against the game's music. It's just me.

The graphics... Are passable. Some things look good (the ships) and some things look terrible (the characters). The post processing is absolutely horrific though. I'd recommend that everyone completely disable that setting at least once to see the difference. It just clouds, blurs, and obstructs your vision.

review:
One of the best multiplayer and coop games I've played. 
You need a few hours to learn how to play in the different roles (captain. gunner and engemeer), but once you understand everything it becomes really satisfying.
If you're a new player be a noice guy and listen to more skilled players, so you will learn how to play properly even faster. 
If you're asking yourself what game you shoud buy, I advice you to get Alliance, because you will get a copy of Online too, so you'll have both PvP and PvE game modes. 
The soundtrack is just great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068950195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 35552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35049, 'last_played': 1529422023}
review:
Guns of Icarus Online was one of my favourite games of all time, and certainly my favourite online game. Guns of Icarus Alliance was... fine. It had potential, but it was squandered. It did, however, mean that PC and PS4 players could crew together seamlessly, which was nice.

Guns of Icarus has jumped the shark.

The future evolution of the game is now in the hands of a single individual who is unable to tell a good idea from a bad one. Anyone that might have reined him in has moved on to other things, leaving the players defenceless against whatever inanities he might slip into the game whenever the servers happen to be down.

If you had asked me at any point between early-2015, when I discovered the game and bought the first of many copies, and early-2018 whether or not you should get this game, I would have said, "yes! Buy copies for all your friends, and play every single hour that you are able. There is no other game like it, and no other game will give you such teamwork, such camaraderie, and give you the absolute knowledge that 5-4 is fundamentally the best score whether you are Blue or Red."

No longer.

Do not buy this game. Its greatness has gone, and you missed it.

The only issue is that not enough people play it, in all honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040361266', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1548742275}
review:
This is the best co op experience that you could ever have.  Whether you win or lose a match depends on the coordination and communication of your crew.  Though I will warn you that it is one of those games that is a ton better if you have a microphone to communicate with your crew and almost essential for a captain.

This game deserves to be way more popular than it is and I will strongly suggest buying this game, especially if you could rope some of your friends intro it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972815443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1534868828}
review: Guns of Icarus Online was a great PvP game with a small but active and friendly community. They could have kept improving the game and growing the playerbase. What did they do instead? They spent years making this boring and pointless Alliance PvE extension which doesn't even get close to what they promised it would be in the first place. The release of Alliance only divided the already small community into PvP and PvE. Now as a result the game is dead. This is a parade example of bad decision making. GJ devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981359022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2358, 'last_played': 1690311760}
review:
This game is great ! Especially if you like steampunk and airships. Every ship and gun has a use and can be efficient, so it is well balanced. Thanks to that, you can have a wide variety of gameplays. 

The PVE is well done with different difficulties to test and hone your skills and those of your crew. The gamemodes are nice too and depending on them you must adapt your loadout if you want to be efficient.

I didn't try the PVP a lot, but it seems well balanced.

The only thing that would make this game better would be a bigger playerbase !

author: {'steamid': '76561198095924054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1534223389}
review:
Too late.

After playing so much of guns of icarus in 2010 , I've already lost interest to play the expansion which I finally got to try out for free. The repairing mechanic in this game is so boring and it's unavoidable, which makes it hard for me to ever come back and enjoy it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004698823', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1554962022}

review: Получил игру бесплатно. Имел 0 ожиданий. Игра оказалась просто потрясающей. Пока пробовал именно новый PVE кооперативный режим - с другими игроками или ИИ против ИИ противников в различных миссиях. Стиль уникальный - напоминает старые "Рыцари Поднебесья" и "Проект Бродяги". Разработчики - молодцы. Мне - угодили.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075724365', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1615343320}
review: Same game except with the addition of co-op mode. Still underattedly wonderful, though I would not reccomend getting the game if you already have the first one. Sad to see that the game has low player count as well. I've only played the PVP modes so my thoughts on it is that it's a nice Co-op death match game. There are some tricky things to learn when playing but you'd have to commit to the game(I know there some). Do get the game, have some fun, and get a microphone( you are gonna need it)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160140923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1533976834}
review:
Got this game free from Humble Bundle, had some good fun. They made it rewarding to play as pilot and engineer, people no longer fight for gunner role.

However, in less than a month everyone's gone, only 60 players online at the time I write this review. I know it's probably not the dev's fault, but I deem the current state of the game almost unplayable. Gotta admit, freemium a.k.a pay-to-win games have bigger playerbase than pay-to-play games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208417667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2354, 'last_played': 1565411074}
review:
Me and my boys played the original version (Guns of Icarus Online) all the time back in 2016. The legacy of TwoFats and the Hesitating Buisnessmen are still legendary in some circles.

However, after a tragic slip and slide incident, we sealed the game away for good.

Then suddenly,

We try out Alliance.

It's pretty ok. Still can't name myself TwoFarts, so I'm still TwoFats. Other than that, it's always a good time to go up in some dumb airship with some people you know and some you don't, and kill all the bad people who insulted your tiny hat. The game has a small playerbase, but it's ok becuase almost everyone I've met is chill and sometimes even slavic. Make sure to rush B during defense, blin. There was this one guy who was whining about a new guy not knowing how to play, but it was ok because everyone made fun of him for being a whiny crybaby who has no girlfriend who takes a game way to seriously, and I personally trained the new guy so he's mediocre now.

Also MUSE fix your AI director normal is way too easy and any other difficulty is literally the dArK Souls of Guns of Icarus. DOn't matter if the AI pull back once you are close to die, there is an absurd amount already guuning for you and they just kill you anyway. was once in a 4 ship lobby vs. hard ai and so many enemy spawned that we got surrondeed and poundered and not in the fun way.

if you area playeing the game i recommenrd defense is the best also MUSe hurrry up with endless defsense ok? 

all inall games ok its nice toa play

author: {'steamid': '76561198083217772', 'num_games_owned': 1643, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1660686139}
review:
The AI Gunners/Engineers are actually pretty capable of keeping you alive, so if you're not that interested in having ships containing a crew full of players, you can take 3 friends and pilot a ship each and actually not get trashed instantly during missions. 

Would recommend keeping ships to 3 players and 1 AI, as the AI will probably respond faster to repairs then your human crew mates will, so people can focus more in destruction and less on running around with a wrench.

review:
a game where you and your buddies fly in a zeppelin like thing shooting down other zeppelin like things

+its cool
+its fun for some time
+its interesting
-confusing is there a story at all ?
-can get repetative
-can get boring
-so you can switch factions whenever you want but everytime you do you lose 100 reputation points ? but can you get back into that same faction if you leave it once ? again confusing i still dont understand the faction thingy

in the end its fun i liked it its interesting to me i would recommend it just because its so cool going in a zeppelin shooting down other zeppelins though id recommend playing with friends ive played alone which got boring quickly but from the videos ive seen playing with friends seems a lot more chaotic,fun,interesting well it just basically looks better i would still recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198026791648', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1532749669}
review:
Honestly, tremendously disappointed. I had hoped that this game would be better than it's predecessor but it's the polar opposite of what made it's predecessor somewhat good.

You would think that PvE is EXACTLY what this game needed. And you'd be right, because it is.
You would think that the PvE is similar to normal PvP matches, and that it solves the issue of having a lot of people required to play a game that has an extremely thin community. You are very wrong.

The fact is that to play PvE you still need a full crew on your ship (No surprises there) but you also need to find a match with 2 full crews, which is honestly ridiculous. I  can see that they wanted to make it so that the whole fleet would work as one but even if you DO find a match, no one talks between each other to coordinate smack, not like it helps anyways BECAUSE:

The AI is garbage and they will just throw dozens of them to overwhelm you.
It is not even funny, the AI will literally RAM YOU, go right up next to mountains, sometimes CRASH INTO OBSTACLES, and you will STILL DIE, because there are 6 ships doing exactly the same.

To summarize, dead game + shit AI + high player requirement =

"2 friends want this game" - No, Jared. You don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028615861', 'num_games_owned': 1143, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1532810593}
review: Guns of Icarus Alliance nos planta ante la situación de, coordinándonos con otros jugadores, controlar un zeppelin de combate en batalla. Lo que como punto de partida es una idea chula, acaba siendo unas mecánicas de juego muy lentas y farragosas, con un tempo bastante mediocre que hace que las batallas carezcan de pasión. El resultado es que pilotar no parece especialmente entretenido, disparar tampoco, y reparar es bastante coñazo. Gráficamente el juego no tiene un mal diseño pero tampoco es espectacular ni de lejos, y a nivel de sonido no lo hace mucho mejor. Con todo lo cual, es un juego que claramente no vale la pena. Una buena idea que podría haber dado algo grande pero no lo ha hecho. Un 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186215147', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1555, 'last_played': 1594016951}
review: Ok its like this, this game requires you to work together. A pilot is nothing without thier crew,  this game fosters this feeling of group play to a T. Many battles i have flown into and taken my ship on a wild ride, without the support of my crew i would have been crushed. If you like the physics of flight, try "balloon" flying. You like to sit on a gun and hammer yer foes? here you can. Different rounds, and styles of guns are sure to satisfy any gunner. Engies, well what can you say? You like fast paced, crucial teamwork? This is for you then, while your pilot flys into battle and your gunners kill the enemy, your job is running around keeping the ship in the air,(tip: establish a "route" to run on the ship so when its hectic you dont have to think "where?"). Fire and thunder are your companions as you fight fires fix guns and repair the hull and engines. I have loved this game since the start and am so glad to see it active.  Give it a shot, grab some friends and join us in the skies. Some of the old clans still exist mine included so find a group and make some noise. The price is very fair and the fun is endless. Im not tied to the game people at all, but I am a huge fan and a passionate pilot.

developer_response:
Sorry to hear you can't recommend us.

We have designed Guns of Icarus with team cooperation in mind, both on each ship and between ships, so an internet connection is required. The account you register in the game is used to access our game forums at https://gunsoficarus.com/community/forum/ .

For the CTDs, can I have you email your crash logs (found in the game's install folder) to feedback@musegames.com ? We'll have a look and do our best to solve any problems you're experiencing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153957476', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1531440199}
review:
Herkese tekrardan selamlar... (Diğer incelememin aynısını yazıyorum çünkü ikisi de aynı oyun)

Bu incelememizde sizi ilk saatlerde sıkmazken daha sonraları bunaltan bir oyuna bakacağız...
Guns of Icarus kesinlikle ve kesinlikle takım ile oynanan, free takılmak isteseniz bile buna izin vermeyen, illa savaş gerektiren bir oyundur. Neden böyle pat diye kötülediğimi sorabilirsiniz. Evet kötülemememin sebebi şirketin elinde güzel bir malzeme varken bunu yalnızca gemi savaşlarına odaklı bir şey yapması bana göre aşırı derecede saçma olmuş. 

Şimdi oyuna geçmeden evvel müziklerinin gayet hoşuma gittiğini söylemek isterim. Ayrıca oyundan evvel karakterimizin ve gemimizin özelleştirilmesi beni baya bi umutlandırmıştı. Hatta ve hatta bir birlik seçip onun adına savaşmamız istenmesi bile beni heyecanlandırmıştı. 
FAKAT oyunu oynamaya başladığımda hayal kırıklığına uğradım diyebilirim. Güzel bir trailer ı varken training i güzel bir şekilde gösterirken, hikaye ile çok da alakası olmayan savaşlara girmekten, sürekli onu bunu patlatmaya çalışmaktan artık gına geleceğiniz bir oyun olduğunu malesef görmüş oluyorsunuz.

Şimdi burda bana kızan kişiler olduğuna eminim. "Ulan gerizekalı ne bekliyodun ki zaten?" falan dediğinizi de duyar gibiyim. Fakat dediğim gibi firmanın elinde çok harika bir malzeme var ve hikayesi de gayet ilgimi çekti. Bunu yedirmek adına sürekli savaşmaktan ziyade free takılacağımız, içinde rpg ögelerinin de bulunduğu açık dünya haritasına sahip bir oyun da yapılabilirdi bence. Hatta ve hatta savaşlarda onu vur bunu öldür tarzı görevler yerine daha yaratıcı görevler verilebilirdi. Veyahut savaşları görev olarak verebilirdi.
Sonuçta arkadaşlarımızla oynuyoruz evet. Fakat aksiyon manyağı biri değilseniz ordan oraya koşturup gemi patlatmaktan en fazla ne kadar zevk alabilirsiniz onu gerçekten merak ediyorum. Oyunun haritaları gerçekten büyük. Oyundaki grafikler gerçekten harika. Aksiyon dur durak bitmiyor evet fakat bence bu oyun böyle olmalıydı kanımca.

Oyunun serverleri var fakat çoğu şifreli. Yani anlayacağınız üzere herkes kendi arkadaşlarıyla bu oyunu oynuyor. Kendiniz bir server açsanız bile yarım saat sonra oyuna başlıyorsunuz. Oyuncu sayısında ciddi şekilde eksiklik var. Yani oynadığım süre zarfında üç haneli sayıları geçtiğini görmedim. 
Oyunda farklı roller var ve savaşta işe yarar özellikler barındırıyor. Fakat botların birçoğu aptalca hareketler sergiliyor ve çoğu zaman diğer işlere bile kendiniz koşturmak zorunda kalıyorsunuz. Yani bu oyunu oynamak istiyorsanız arkadaş şart. 

Kısacası umduğumun çok altında olan, sürekli amaçsızca bir şeyler patlattığımız, görevlerin ve savaşların mantığının hemen hemen birbirinin aynısı olan, elde güzel bir malzeme varken bunu bana göre çok kötü bir şekilde bize sunan, serverlarının azlığını geçtim aktif oyuncu sayısının beklediğimden çok çok altında olan bu oyunu ciddi söylüyorum sağlam bir arkadaş ortamınız yoksa kesinlikle ALMAYIN. Serverlar dediğim gibi boş, oyuncular kurduğunuz oyuna yarım saatte anca geliyor, oyun arasanız bile şanslı değilseniz 15 dakika beklemeniz gerekiyor. Yani tamamiyle multiplayer üzerine kurulmuş, keşke hikayesi olsa dediğim, hikayesi olmasa bile en azından RPG ve açık dünya olmasını beklediğim bu oyun beni gerçekten hayal kırıklığına uğrattı. Grafikleri ve müzikleri güzel olabilir. Fakat yine de kurtarmıyor.

Saygılar...

Puanım 4,3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086763216', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1625511246}
review:
[h1] After overwhelming request from 'legacy' GoI players... Heres my review [/h1]

Just as a quick disclaimer, I have been a fan of the original Guns of Icarus and had over 200 hours. The concept of steam punk pirate ships in a pvp setting would catch the interest of just about anyone. I will giving as objective a review as possible, as even if I don't reccomend it, I want you to know I wish I earnestly could. 

[b] The Good [/b]
Guns of Icarus Alliance has an interesting addition of PvE which, in theory, would have only bolstered the game's already interesting gameplay.The DLC, adds some cool looking ships with some fancy clans to join as well. 

[b] The Bad [/b]
With so little I found about the good in this game, we're going to dive deeper into why this game frustates me as well as the legacy players of the days of old. 
-The gameplay is stale
I have found that being a captain is GoIA is honestly one of the most boring things to do in a PvE scenario, having only played 3 hours, I found little to no variety in the maps that essentially feel like glorified fetch quests. GoIA adds a system to fight over territories where the grind feels unrewarding and ultimately feels like a waste of time. 
-Hardly any new content as a whole
For $15.00USD I would not reccomend buying this. This new 'game' is hardly worth 5 with the amount of effort it feels went into the development. The pvp meta has changed very little in the 2 years I waited to play this (coming from GoI) Meaning that with no new ways to really change up the way we fight on ships, the new content leaves much more to be desired. 
-Poor Map Design 
As the maps are generally linear, or have very limited spacing in regards to objective pathing, the game just feels like a very shallow objective simulator. With no real effort to make challenging maps, the game becomes stale very quickly. 
-Clunky UI
This shouldn't need too much explaining, the menus just feel excessive, not clean as they probably intended. 

[b] The Ugly [/b]
This game has just been handled incorrectly for years. Plain and simple, watching mistake after mistake being made, the only reason I was even wanting to play this is because it was being given out for free, allowing me to review it fairly. The fact that very little has been done to change anything significant in the game. I LOVE this game in my own way, but the fact that there is no feasible way to revive this player base breaks my heart. I used to binge this game constantly but then as alliance launched, I felt torn as even now, this offers nothing interesting enough to warrant a price tag. If anything, this feels like it should be free DLC, thats honestly how little it really has to offer. All I can say is, I wish Muse the best, should they learn from their mistakes, their next game might change the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025059376', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2753, 'last_played': 1530074882}
review:
This game has a significant amount of flaws that will outright ruin your enjoyment of it.

Starting with a woefully lacking playerbase,  this game requires up to two full parties of players to launch a match, even in a non-PVP match.  You can make by with less than two full parties, but the duties of those players persist, and the NPCs only work to a certain level of skill.  This said, All the problems stated below only get worse as you fill player roles with NPCs... if you can even get a match started due to the lack of players at a given time.

The roles are unbalanced and their rewards are equally unenthralling.  a good 80% of lasting rewards are ship upgrades, which only applies to the pilot of any given team.  On occasion, you'll unlock a small handful of the dissapointingly limited amount of cosmetic options, but those options will feel too far distant from each other unless you have a chance to play Pilot.

The job of each role themselves can vary slightly, but generally:
* The Pilot need only control and direct the ship,  using items that come at the cost of the ship's health (which has to be rectified by the engineer). A good pilot can make the team, they require an understanding of their ship, it's limitations, and how quickly or easily it can be repaired or be removed from a sticky situation... but you won't find many good pilots
* The gunner need only really point the gun in the right direction and hold down the fire button, but they're at the mercy of the pilot's skills, as there is very little auto-track targeting, and as a gunner you get zero say in the weaponry mounted on the ship.
*The Engineer does everything,  from reparing damage from other ships, repairing damage caused by the pilot, to ignoring the core role to leach out extra DPS or cover for a pilot alseep at the wheel.  The game suggests an unenforced two-engineer-per-ship standard, but due to the demand of the job, you'll likely end up with two gunners and a pilot on your team.

The kit your class/role takes into the game to drive the position is creatively poised, as you can take up to a certain amount of a selection of role-appropriate skills plus one crossrole of each other role.  This is where role flexability seems to end, however, as each class has an independant level and requires grinding to become optimal.  There is no opportunity to change roles on the fly if you need to juggle positions in a pinch (despite the fact that you can with strict limitations due to the crossrole options).  


I've played a fair deal of this game, before and after the alliance expansion, and though I really enjoyed it with a static group of friends, the grind and monotony takes it's toll.  It's lack of real variation of play, unimpressive in-game rewards, dying playerbase, and strained but forced role role exepectations make this game a hard recommendation.  Grab it if you can get it on sale/free, and only if you can get 3-7 more people to join you in the mix.   It is worth your time and money, but only as long as those friends hold out... otherwise you're better off getting an old MMO and grinding it out there for all the good it'll do you.

review: Much like it's PvP-dedicated counterpart, Alliance is a thrilling team-based steampunk PvE (with PvP included) game involving flying ships and is best played with friends. However, also like it's PvP-dedicated counterpart, the player base is very small (around ~200 last I played). Finding a decently filled lobby is as challenging as the game itself.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198126213050', 'num_games_owned': 2930, 'num_reviews': 365, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1530457010}
review:
最大16人で共に戦える飛空艇PvE/PvP。

基本は『Guns of Icarus Online（GoIO）』と全く同じで、そこにPvEモードと國取り合戦が追加されたものとなってます。本作を持っていればGoIOも実質不要です。
4人一組で飛空艇に乗り、全員で船の操舵・修理・砲撃を行なって敵飛空艇を撃墜していくのが「Guns of Icarus」の特徴。
4人で全てを弄るのではなく、クラスごとに割れて作業を行なうので誰が何をすべきか明確に分かる分、遊ぶのも慣れるのも簡単です。

最大16人というのも4人一組が4隻、これでPvP又はPvEができ、足りない部分においてはNPCが参加して補完されますが、あまり知的じゃ無いので可能ならフレンドと4人一組で人員を埋めるのが望ましいです。
醍醐味であるPvEは、様々なルールどれをとっても敵の数がかなり多く、フレンドと遊ぶゲームとしてはワイワイ遊べて良いもですし、状況報告し合ってミッションをクリアした時の達成感は今でも面白いです。

PvPについては、マッチングはGoIOと併せて行われ、全ての要素を触ることができます。逆にPvEモードはアンロック方式で船やスキルを解除していくので本作本来の楽しみ方ができると思います。
なおPvEをプレイする際は、人数が多いほど楽なのでできたら8人ぐらいで遊べると最高です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198117326886', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1530241352}
review:
A game with a fun concept that sadly never seemed to catch very much seeing its playerbase being at 200 people a day at the time of writing this review. 

you play as one of the 4 people on an airship ethier being the pilot , a gunner ,  or an engineer thats trying to keep everything from blowing up. 

Theres co op missions if you hate pvp with objectives like defending a base , survivng waves , or killing enemy bases. no matter which type of mission it is you will be fighting dozens of ai controlled enemy ships alongside whatever freindly player crews you get matched with. it can be alot of fun but gets rather repititive really fast. there alot of waiting around for players to get found and people to ready up. probly due to the dying playerbase. still fun in short bursts tho.

Overall its a game with an interesting concept that suffers in my eyes from a dwindling playerbase. its a shame give a try tho and boost the playerbase a little bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171049518', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1529868483}
review:
Что такое GOI? В чём сок игры?
Вы-отчаянный капитан корабля-дирижабля бороздящего небеса,интеллектуал-инженер на котором вся механика и броня корабля,или отчаянный стрелок с разными наборами патронов,кем быть? Выбирать только вам!
Собирайте команду и вперёд!Эксперементируйте с наборами инструментов,вооружения,патронов,упражняйтесь в тактике боя.В игре 2 основных режима (deathmatch и захват точек) и до 10 карт.


Теперь об Alliance.Перед нами Guns of Icarus (v2.0)
По сути апдейт с сo-op режимом выживания против ИИ.
Новые корабли,пушки,фракции,костюмы,исправлены баги.
Игра подойдет не только любителям steampunk,хоть сеттинг игры именно стимпанковский.
Единственный её минус-маленький онлайн,иногда опускается до 100-200 человек.
Комьюнити игры-минимум школьников и максимум серьезных отыгрывающих роль людей.
В общем,советую всем,цена-смешная,при этом получаете в библиотеку и DLC Alliance и оригинал GOI.Пару десятков часов веселья обеспечены.
Но прийдется выучить английский (80% игроков англоговорящие).

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1529369333}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Guns of Icarus Alliance is a game developed and published by Muse Games, the same people behind Guns of Icarus Online, Guns of Icarus Alliance is a sort of expansion to the main game

The game features all of the content from the original title, but with the addition of player-vs-environment cooperative experiences, an ongoing war between six elite factions vying for control of a world ravaged by machines, and an ever-changing world that is constantly being shaped and reshaped by the players

If you ever played Introversion Software's Uplink, you'd feel right at home with Hacknet. It is a hacking simulated game where you enter into people's computers, steal their precious data and earn cash

The Guns of Icarus franchise is a fantastic indie game series especially to play with your friends, from piloting a ship to fixing the damaged hull to firing flames to the enemy ship. Guns of Icarus Online and Guns of Icarus Alliance truly show how it feels like to be on a ship!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]
[list]
[*] None

author: {'steamid': '76561197965268844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 16576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11991, 'last_played': 1632682892}
review:
Here is the deal,
This game has allot of potential. However it lacks basic game features that most multiplayer games have these days that I find it frustrating to mention because its not an aspect that needs to be discussed however it is behind the reason failure of why this game is slowly dying... They mix their new players with competitive players so you will always have a ship with one or more newbies. The problem is because the newbie doesnt know how to play. They need to be constantly mentored on how to operate the ship and how to to their job. Its fun at first because you might actually learn some new leadership talents through this game... However it is dull when you keep coaching players almost every round I play... about 15% of my gaming experience is held with actual pros. At the end it leaves the player angry because you wasted soo much time playing this game that you always have somebody ruining for you and if its a newbie its sad because he wont enjoy and nethier will the player who is most loyal to the game.
The tuturials are weak in comparision... the game is trial and error learning... though it would have been better if they simply advised the players on how to operate a ship rather than learning first hand on board and usually not getting ir right until after 20 times. Would have been nice if they allowed professionals to design tutrials for players so that its not necsearry to keep training players... 
Simply IT should have been a Casual lobby for training and learning.. Competitive lobby for Veterans and skilled players... 

Anyways I loved this game and the comunity are awesome aswell as the developer community and they have awesome events. I would recommend the game but not the game experience...

author: {'steamid': '76561198205376476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1534513087}
review:
I received this game as a free giveaway during the privateer update, therefore I decided to give it a try with some friends.

Oh boy what a blast !

Airships vs. Airships, with many possibilites in outfitting your character as well as your ship to fit your playstyle, many types of ships for you to discover, and a generally very helpful community and devs. The gameplay is something very unique, and is very well executed. 

I have to say, if you have a bunch of friends and want to have a great time together, get this game! The only downsides are the generally low amount of players and the complexity this game shows in the beginning. Neither of them is much of an issue however: the co-op mode is difficult enough to provide you a challenge against clever bots, it features many gamemodes, and you don't need to wait for many teammates because the AIs will listen to every command you give; the game is indeed very complex at start, however by replaying the tutorial and reading the not-so-long manual, you definitely will get a grip of what's going on, and can then hone your skills in co-op! 

You will rarely run into people raging (I've never encountered any myself except from my friends shouting in my ear), maybe some people will speak a language differnt than yours, but there is always a built-in voice command if you don't feel like talking yourself.

TL;DR : This game is a fun game to try out, with friend or without. I definitely recommend it with friends, but if you prefer to play solo then either wait for a discount, as the enjoyment in singleplayer is rather limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083822797', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1735, 'last_played': 1529652718}
review:
First, I received this product for free. Because I feel it's important for indie devs to have feedback, I wanted to hand out my opinion so far:

The bad points: 

- Questionnable UI: It required us one full hour to get accostumed to the weird elements. Most games now have the social tools in right bottom of the screen, this game has it in top left. Notifications have no sounds. We didn't manage to play the tutorial together, and it ruined a lot our immersion into the game. We almost dropped because of that. When you receive an invitation to play a game, you don't have the option to accept or refuse. Rather, when you click on the notification, the game automatically understands it as if you accept the invitation. So it's bad. A little green square with "accept" and a little red square with "refuse" would be far more intuitive. Another thing I noted, if you leave a game (in coop supposingly), you cannot resume to the party you are in (as usual) and so, you can't configure your loadoat, if you can, I didn't find how.  

- The worst thing in a game that is supposed to focus heavily on strategy and build up, is that you cannot see what your teamate choose for their tools. It makes most choice you make redundant because the game doesn't give you the option to visualise easily your allies' loadoats. For example: the special ability, that is equivalent to an ultimate in most moba games, can be wasted if two ingies picks the same (or reduce greatly its effectiveness). There should be a way where you are in game to see your allies loadout as well, or at least now the cooldown of their "special abilities". 

- The whole thing about factions. While the game seems to emphasise a lot on that, I don't see what it brings to me as an individual player, nor I see what imput I have in the whole war when I invest the money of the "war chest" somewhere. It just feels like it's pointless. I don't feel involved and it's wrong. There are no tutorial or guides in game that is clearly shown to explain the mechanics. The only thing I know it's the factions when you reach a certain level gives you access to weapons or ships (I suppose). The mechanics about the faction should be more properly explained. 

- I have a mid-tier setup and the game lags heavily, even with the lowest setting in coop, making it almost unplayable at some points, especially during boss fight when there is a lot of particles. At some points, it feels like a chore to play. 

- I saw in some guides it's useless to pick anything else for a tool than the spyglass. Then, why would you enable the ingies and the gunners to choose the other equipments? It feels pointless and just confuse more the new players. There should be a note in red at least that the piloting equipments aside from the spyglass are not usefull if you don't pick the pilot. 

The good points:

- Despite what I said previously, the game is still fun to play. The game delivers what I expected it to sell: a team-based game with steampunk ships. This aspect gives this game an unique flavor where you cannot find elsewhere, because the player itself is completly absorbed in one bigger entity called the ship, that functions in the maner of a hive mind. 

- The option to play with IA and the opportunity for other players to join your game is great! Despite what's the other reviewers postulated that this game is dead, I was pleasantly surprised that some people joined our game. So far, I have little thing to say about the community, since I only met two or three people but they seemed mostly involved toward the goals fixed by the game, which is nice. 

To conclude, so far, I have a positive view on this game. Let's see how it will develop in the future.
